job_title: Conversational Artificial Designer, Senior Consultant - Applied Artificial Intelligence
job_Description: Work you'll do  At Deloitte, you'll gather requirements and design for a variety of conversational interfaces and creative business technology solutions for enterprise clients. As a rigorous language-first UX designer with a creative flair for content and expertise in conversational AI technologies, you'll:  Gather requirements, design flows, and write content for IVR, VUI/voice user interfaces, Virtual Assistants, Chatbots, and omnichannel conversational interfaces Drive and own persona definition, functional design, process design (including scenario design, flow mapping), prototyping, testing, model/intent training, and definition of support procedures Work with engagement leadership, project managers, conversational AI architects, developers, UX designers, product managers, and fellow consultants to strategize, design, and deliver enterprise conversational AI solutions Collaborate with clients, partner professional services teams, and project leadership to identify business requirements and design voice and digital self-service solutions for diverse use cases across industries and modalities Contribute to enterprise content strategy guides and design omnichannel and cross-channel solutions aligned with client organizational principles (brand voice and tone, legal, compliance, etc.) Contribute to Deloitte's vibrant design culture through design sprints, workshops, reviews, and related activities with business, technical, and creative leadership (client and internal) Design and deliver POCs, demos, prototypes, and sales collateral in alignment with engagement and practice leadership and sales executives across the firm  The team  Analytics & Cognitive  In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.  The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy practice, our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting organizational intelligence programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets.  Analytics & Cognitive will work with our clients to:  Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance and the integration of structured and unstructured data to generate insights leveraging cloud-based platforms Leverage automation, cognitive and science-based techniques to manage data, predict scenarios and prescribe actions Drive operational efficiency by maintaining their data ecosystems, sourcing analytics expertise and providing As-a-Service offerings for continuous insights and improvements  Qualifications   Required:  3+ years of relevant work experience in VUI or conversational design in or around contact centers and/or enterprise virtual assistants 2+ years' experience leading workstreams or small teams Experience collaborating with conversational AI and contact center developers, architects, and other relevant team members Group facilitation skills Fluent in design thinking and conversation design methodology Experience with requirements gathering, documentation, and tracking Experience designing and delivering conversational AI MVPs, pilots, and POCs Demonstrable experience designing and/or deploying: VUI / IVR flows for enterprise contact centers Voice and/or text-based conversational flows for virtual agents or virtual assistants Experience with flow design and prototyping tools (Figma, Sketch, Visio, Axure, InVision, etc) Deep understanding of software development lifecycle and agile delivery methodologies Understanding of natural language technology, the tech stack behind modern conversational experiences, and how to design for current abilities and limitations Experience scripting video and creative materials for POCs, marketing demos, and interactive sales collateral Bachelor's degree in linguistics, English/creative writing/literatures, human-computer interaction, interaction design, or a related content or design field Ability to travel up to 50% (While 50% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.) Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.    Preferred:  2+ years of consulting experience on Contact Center, VUI/IVR, and/or conversational AI projects Expertise in 1+ domains preferred (e.g., Customer & Marketing, Finance, M&A, Operations, Pricing, Risk, Supply Chain, Workforce, etc.) Certification or expertise in at least one of the following platforms: Amazon Lex / Alexa; GCP Dialogflow ES, CX or CCAI; IBM Watson, IPSoft Amelia, Kore.ai, Nuance Nina, Salesforce Einstein Amazon Connect, Genesys, Twilio, NICE inContact, Five9, 8x8, Avaya Enterprise UX writing, content design, or content strategy experience Demonstrable experience in Healthcare, Technology, Media, Telecommunications, Consumer (especially transportation) and/or Financial Services & Insurance Ability to work independently and manage small engagements or parts of large engagements Strong oral and written communication skills; presentation skills (MS Office, PowerPoint, Visio, etc.) Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with mature judgement Advanced degree in creative writing, linguistics, or a relevant content-, writing-or design-focused discipline   anccon  A&C_Consulting21

job_title: Senior Principal Consultant -Data Scientist: Analytics Specialist-(US-NSG)
job_Description: Desired Requirement: This position requires that the applicant possess a U.S. Top Secret/SCI security clearance with a Poly. If the applicant does not possess a Poly consideration will be given to applicants who possess a lesser clearance and/or background check. U.S. Citizenship is mandatory. Oracleâ€™s National Security Group/Consulting is looking for a Data Scientist: Analytics Specialist to strengthen our ability to deliver unique, intuitive, and exciting analytic applications and data concepts for our innovative emerging technologies. Weâ€™re charting new territory in analytic enablement-and need imaginative and talented DS analytic specialists to provide new ways to select, see, use, and exploit data. Weâ€™re solving difficult analytic problems and empowering users through dynamic, flexible, and intuitive capabilities. Weâ€™re seeking high-performing candidates to design and implement novel mechanisms that enable users to collate data, discover insights, unearth buried tidbits, and tell compelling analytic stories. This role will design technologies, pioneer advanced algorithms, and implement top-level analytic innovations. We want someone with an extensive background in data analytics who loves to work with multi-disciplinary teams to construct truly revolutionary ways to enable analysis. We need individuals who can incorporate ideas from diverse perspectives and distill challenging problems into effective capabilities-including ways to understand, consume, and enhance data. Youâ€™ll advocate for advancements that you know will resonate with the user. Youâ€™ll impact and influence how analysis is done. What youâ€™ll do Big picture -Drive analytic strategy, development, and execution -Build models and prototypes to identify meaningful, actionable insights from large, disparate data sources -Work with multi-disciplinary teams to develop impactful analytic enablement mechanisms -Solve operational/analytic problems with robust, statistically sound scientific methodologies and creative algorithms -Create baseline analytic processes, questions, methodologies, and mechanisms to facilitate capability and feature development/coding -Stay atop current industry trends, best practices, and technologies Into the details -Enable consumption of complex analysis and results by both technical and non-technical audiences -Explore and design applications that consolidate and analyze diverse, structured/unstructured big data sources -Create content and documentation to illustrate analytic capabilities and user impact -Design creative and interactive data visualizations with real-time flexibility -Identify questions and issues for current and future data analysis and experimentation -Produce effective stories through data visualization and analytic representations -Construct data science use cases including data aggregation, feature engineering and customization, data/result visualization, and capability deployment/implementation/monitoring -Construct exploratory tools and leverage AI/ML to enable and advance analytic capabilities -Integrate stakeholder requirements to advance existing technologies and/or design new capabilities -Develop capabilities for anomaly/fraud detection, predictive/forecasting analysis, content moderation, lead identification, automation, sentiment analysis, and creative data exploration/evaluation What you bring -Bachelorâ€™s degree or equivalent experience in the analytics-focused area -Minimum three (3) years of experience of data mining, data analytics, data science, and/or data visualizations -Self-motivation and proactive approach with excellent time management and verbal/written communication skills -Dexterity in articulating how analytic capabilities and proficiency can solve stakeholder problem sets -Demonstrated intellectual curiosity and passion about data, visualizations, and solving tough analytic problems -Creative, original, and inventive thinking -Proven ability to effectively navigate and collaborate with various groups/resources in complex environments -Familiarity with the intelligence community (IC) or military intelligence -Practical experience in  -Designing, innovating and exploring advanced algorithms and solutions for complex problems  -Evaluating and investigating predictive analytic products, task automation, model interpretation/visualization, and feature purpose, evaluation, and selection  -Big data processing engines and query languages (e.g. Spark, Kafka, SQL, Python, R, Java, C++, Scala, NoSQL)  -Data integrity, integration, and visualization    An experienced consulting professional who has a broad understanding of solutions, industry best practices, multiple business processes or technology designs within a product/technology family. Operates independently to provide quality work products to an engagement. Performs varied and complex duties and tasks that need independent judgment, in order to implement Oracle products and technology to meet customer needs. Applies Oracle methodology, company procedures, and leading practices.  Operates independently to provide quality work products to an engagement. Performs varied and complex duties and tasks that need independent judgment, in order to implement Oracle products and technology to meet customer needs. Applies Oracle methodology, company procedures, and leading practices. Demonstrates expertise to deliver functional and technical solutions on moderately complex customer engagements. May act as the team lead on projects, providing coaching, guidance and feedback to develop skills of team members. Effectively consults with management of customer organizations. Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience preferred. Product or technical expertise relevant to practice focus. Ability to communicate effectively. Ability to build rapport with team members and clients. Ability to travel as needed.  Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. Thatâ€™s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.   Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

Job Description    Job Description HII Technical Solutions Division (HII-TSD) is seeking a Senior Data Scientist to support our customer in Springfield, Virginia. This Data Scientist will work as a team member with other big data specialists who are developing unique capabilities that directly support intelligence and operations personnel. In this role, you will work with a premier team of intel and technology professionals, on a massive, relevant, and diverse trove of data. You will have access to a peerless platform that was designed and developed from the ground up to leverage this diverse data trove. You will be challenged, you will be tested, and you will be forced to engage your own creativity each day. This is a “RAD/JAD” environment in which tasks are rapidly defined and executed in a way that ensures maximum user input, feedback, and adoption.  Essential Job Responsibilities  Serve as a Data Scientist in support of a multi-discipline intelligence team. In conjunction with the Systems Engineers ensure the data is effectively received, processed, and postured. Work with the Intelligence SME’s to build and deliver premier suites of analytics capabilities.  Collaborate closely with the Agile Software Developer (ASDs), Technical Targeting Developer (TTDs), and the end user analysts to write and implement cutting edge big data algorithms and analytics.  Employ scientific data extraction, manipulation, and analysis techniques to unlock the potential of massive data sets. Ensure quality and confidence meet standards for effective data utilization.  Participate in software and systems testing, validation, and maintenance processes through test witnessing, certification of software, and other activities as directed.  Enable simultaneous access of disparate data sources through the design of highly complex queries and the application of other data science techniques.  Devise modeling and measuring techniques; utilize mathematics, statistical methods, data engineering methods, operational mathematics techniques (linear programming, game theory, probability theory, symbolic language, etc.), and other principles and laws of scientific and economic disciplines.  Ensure that internally developed capabilities remain interoperable with our external partners.  Collect data using a combination of standard intelligence methods and business processes. Conduct surveys, evaluate reliability of source information, adjust and weigh raw data, analyze and interpret statistics and organizes results.  Write, review, edit, and release white papers and final intelligence products for customers, the intelligence community (IC), and senior executives.   *TE *MV  Minimum Qualifications  15 years relevant experience with Bachelors in related field; 13 years relevant experience with Masters in related field; 10 years relevant experience with PhD or Juris Doctorate in related field; or High School Diploma or equivalent and 19 years relevant experience.  COMPTIA Security+ certification or CISSP certification  Proficiency in two or more of the following programming languages: C#, Java, .NET, Python, Perl, Ruby, or similar  Familiarity with current Agile methods  Proficiency with: Multiple operating systems including UNIX, Linux, Windows, Cisco, iOS, etc.  Machine learning, data mining, and knowledge discovery  Analytic algorithm design and implementation  ETL processes, including document parsing techniques  Networking, computer, and storage technologies  Using or designing RESTful APIs, SOAP, XML  Developing large cloud software projects, preferably in Java, Python or C++ language  Java/J2EE, multithreaded and concurrency systems  Multi-threaded, big data, distributive cloud architectures and frameworks including Hadoop, MapReduce, Cloudera, Hive, Spark, Elasticsearch, etc. for the purposes of conducting analytic algorithm design and implementation  NoSQL database such as Neo4J, Titan, Mongo, Cassandra, and hBase  AWS Services (EC2, Network, ELB, S3/EBS, etc.)  Web services environments and technologies such as XML, KML, SOAP, and JSON  Processing and managing large data sets (multi-PB scale)  Clearance: Must possess and maintain a TS/SCI clearance   Preferred Requirements  Master’s Degree in Computer Science or related field (e.g. Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering)  Distributed computing-based certifications  Proficiency with the following:  Trouble shooting in complex distributed environments - tracing root cause from stack to code  Management/tracking utilities such as Jira, Redmine, or similar  Running Internet facing or Service Level Agreement (SLA'd) auto-deployed environments  Real-time media protocols (Real-time Transport Protocol (RTP), Secure Real-time Transport Protocol (SRTP))  Data transfer systems such NiFi  Text processing: NPL, NER, entity retrieval (e.g. Solr/Lucene), topic extraction, summarization, clustering, etc.  Certification from an Agile certified institute, International Consortium for Agile, Scaled Agile Academy, Scrum Alliance, Scrum.org, International Scrum Institute, ScrumStudy, Project Management Institute - Agile Certified Practitioner, or similar XP/Scrum certification or training is desired  Support to SOF; Previous experience with technology, intelligence and cyber under the umbrella of USSOCOM   Physical Requirements May require working in an office, industrial, shipboard, or laboratory environment. Capable of climbing ladders and tolerating confined spaces and extreme temperature variances.  Building on a legacy of more than a century of naval shipbuilding, Technical Solutions, a division of Huntington Ingalls Industries provides mission-critical solutions to a wide variety of government and commercial customers worldwide. Comprising nearly 6,000 professionals in 45 states and 16 countries, our unique national security services portfolio includes unmanned systems, defense and federal solutions, and nuclear and environmental services. For more information, visit tsd.huntingtoningalls.com.  Huntington Ingalls Industries is America’s largest military shipbuilding company and a provider of professional services to partners in government and industry. For more than a century, HII’s Newport News and Ingalls shipbuilding divisions in Virginia and Mississippi have built more ships in more ship classes than any other U.S. naval shipbuilder. HII’s Technical Solutions division supports national security missions around the globe with unmanned systems, nuclear and environmental services, and defense and federal solutions. Headquartered in Newport News, Virginia, HII employs more than 42,000 people operating both domestically and internationally. For more information, visit: www.huntingtoningalls.com. U.S. Citizenship may be required for certain positions. Manager, Financial Modeling and Analysis Dulles - Sterling, VA Who we are: Sallie Mae is proud to help Americans aspiring to create the life they imagine—whether that means helping them make college happen, or other endeavors they pursue to invest in their future. Our colleagues across departments and across the country are united in our passion and our customer-first approach. Whether you want to join a growing company, be part of an agile workforce, or gain new skills—you’re in the right place.  What You'll Contribute   The Manager will be part of a team responsible for loan portfolio modeling and analysis, and development and ongoing enhancement of Current Expected Credit Loss (CECL) and Capital Stress-Testing (CST) methodologies. The individual will utilize broad expertise and specialized modeling knowledge to translate quantitative performance metrics into easily understood analysis for senior management. Make recommendations for process enhancements and development of alternative methodologies. The Manager will be responsible for managing the Loan Loss Work Group (LLWG) and Critical Accounting Assumptions (CAA) processes, the SOX 404 internal control framework and will have primary responsibility for responding to audit inquiries related to these activities. In addition, the incumbent will ensure compliance with Sallie Mae's model governance framework. The incumbent will manage the ongoing enhancement of CECL models and other analytical frameworks, as well as ad hoc requests related to CECL. The Manager will be responsible for execution of various elements of the securitization transaction process, including managing the rating agency relationship, providing collateral information to the rating agencies, working with the rating agencies to receive loan performance assumptions, and recommending whether the assumptions should be accepted or disputed. The incumbent will manage production of presentation materials related to securitization offerings and develop new materials and disclosures for investors. The Manager will also play a key role in cross functional projects such as the launch of new programs, portfolio strategies, or risk classifications. Collaborate with peer groups to effectively plan, communicate, organize, and execute business objectives. Lead efforts to migrate analytical products to a common format and production environment.    What You'll Do   Description  % of Time Spent   Current Expected Credit Losses (CECL) Process Develops and implements of CECL estimation models. Understand impacts of models on the allowance for loan and lease losses (ALLL), credit risk, profitability and technology. Ensure models meet supervisory expectations for model risk management. Ensures that the models undergo periodic validation to show they remain accurate for use and will oversee the redevelopment or enhancement of the models to maintain their predictiveness over time.  40%   Loan Loss Work Group (LLWG) & Critical Accounting Assumptions (CAA) Processes Oversees the existing suite of statistical and financial models. Presents findings to senior management and act as the subject matter expert on matters related to loan performance. Plans course of related enhancement projects, including milestones, resources needed, use of tools and documentation. Maintain project tracking, project plans and report status to management.  20%   Securitization Process Pool Selection – defines criteria and concentration limits for asset pooling and analytics. Rating Agency Relationship - plays a lead role in discussions with the rating agencies both in and outside the transaction context, working to continue to provide analysis and education to facilitate their review of existing and future securitization transactions. Manages the ongoing reporting and analysis of securitization transaction performance as Sallie Mae Banks's securitization program develops  10%   Ad-hoc Analysis Develops analysis products to support projects that arise because of new loan products, operational changes and legislative developments.  10%   Employee Development Assists new hires in on-boarding and training process ensuring smooth integration to team Plans, directs and organizes work of staff within respective team Provides coaching and guidance to staff. Effectively communicate performance expectations and performance against those goals as well as offer insights as to methods to achieve goals. Selects, retains and develops talent for team.  10%     The above information is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this job; it is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees in this role.       Required Qualifications:  What You Need to Succeed   Being focused on our customer helps us to deliver a lasting impression and instill trust. Through collaboration and teamwork, we are able to communicate effectively across departments leading to better decision quality. We hold ourselves to the highest standards ensuring accountability in all we do to deliver on our mission and shared values. A leader at Sallie Mae will need to be strategic with their teams to achieve our corporate goals. Their ability to drive our vision and purpose amongst their teams and helping them to develop to the next level of talent will be imperative. Being able to adapt to situations quickly and effectively will foster a positive proactive work environment and result in a leader being successful at Sallie Mae.    What You Have   Minimum: Indicate minimum education, skills and experience required.   Bachelor’s Degree in Economics, Mathematics, or Finance.   5+ years of modeling/analytic experience.   Strong experience in SAS and SQL   Strong financial analysis, statistical, and modeling skills.   Familiarity with statistical modeling techniques.   Strong communication and interpersonal skills.   Ability to operate in a fast-paced environment.   Highly Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Power BI, and PowerPoint.   Strong financial analysis and modeling skills including experience in portfolio analytics and the capacity to understand and interpret complex financial models.   Background in developing and/or re-engineering financial models and processes   Demonstrated collaborative partnership skills with internal and external teams.   Strong planning, organizational and follow up skills; ability to multi-task and maintain composure; strong sense of urgency with the ability to execute quickly, timely and efficiently.   Strong conceptual, analytical and business judgment with great detail orientation.     Accountability  - Hold self and others accountable to meet commitments.   Collaboration  - Build partnerships and work collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.   Communication  - Develop and deliver multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.   Customer focus  - Build strong customer relationships and delivers customer-centric solutions.   Decision quality  - Make good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.   Instill trust  - Gain the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity, and authenticity.   Develop talent  - Develop people to meet both their career goals and the organization’s goals.   Situational adaptability  - Adapt approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations.   Strategic mindset  - See ahead to future possibilities and translate them into breakthrough strategies.   Drive vision and purpose  - Paint a compelling picture of the vision and strategy that motivates others to action.     Preferred: Indicate “nice to haves” regarding education, skills, and experience. CECL Data visualization tools     The Americans with Disabilities Act   The Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (ADA) prohibits discrimination by employers, in compensation and employment opportunities, against qualified individuals with disabilities who, with or without reasonable accommodation, can perform the “essential functions” of a job. A function may be essential for any of several reasons, including: the job exists to perform that function, the employee holding the job was hired for his/her expertise in performing the function, or only a limited number of employees are available to perform that function.       What You'll Get at Sallie Mae: Comprehensive Compensation  and Healthcare Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision plans) Financial Well-being : 401(k) company match, employee stock purchase plan, and basic life insurance and short-term disability are provided to employees at no cost Work/Life Balance : Paid time off, time off to volunteer, and tuition reimbursement. In addition, after 6 months of employment, primary caregivers receive 12 weeks of 100% fully paid time off and secondary caregivers are eligible for 4 weeks of 100% fully paid time off, for birth or adoption Wellness : Fitness centers/gym subsidies, free Fitbits with step challenges, and wellness education

Overview: The Machine Learning Engineer develops and implements algorithms and related software to analyze and predict system / component health, machine performance, and application metrics for large mining haul trucks. Responsibilities: Develops real time and post processing algorithms and related software used to analyze machine data for failure prediction of electrical and mechanical equipment used on large mining haul trucks Develops algorithms and related software used to analyze machine performance, efficiency, and application metrics Analyzes machine process data sets using deep learning techniques to discover potential algorithms Ensures software development process compliance to internal standards Organizes software structure to ensure stable operating system Creates documentation to describe software design Interfaces with other groups (Mechanical, Electrical, Software, Hydraulic, etc.) to create specifications that outline software functions Evaluates alternative software programming tools and languages Work within a requirements management process and infrastructure Works independently and as a team member with other engineers, designers, and production personnel or on ad hoc projects Participates in Engineering Development Progr Qualifications: Education and Experience: A Master of Science Degree or Master of Engineering Degree (M.S. / M.E. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar) is preferred, or a Bachelor of Science Degree (B.S. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar). Ability to apply deep learning skills for developing neural networks, application of artificial intelligence (AI) and other techniques to derive algorithms Ability to model and simulate systems to test algorithms for suitability Knowledge of a broad set of algorithms and applied math Knowledge of probability and statistics Knowledge of Big Data techniques and tools Knowledge of high level software languages (e.g. Java, C/C++, etc.) Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g. MATLAB, Python, Bash, etc.) Knowledge of simulation tools and model based design (e.g. Simulink) Knowledge of unit testing and software validation techniques Knowledge of application lifecycle management tools (e.g. DOORS, PTC Integrity, TFS) Knowledge of source control systems (e.g. Git, Subversion) Ability to work with software configuration management processes and workflows preferred but not required Knowledge of software development standards/guidelines (e.g. CMMI) preferred but not required Knowledge of heavy machinery or automotive preferred Ability to write specifications that describe software function Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance manuals, and procedure manuals, software specifications Knowledge of Agile and Waterfall software development lifecycles and V-model methodology and their required workflows and tools Additional Requirements: Is expected to travel nationally and internationally up to 20% to customer sites, supplier sites, or regional proving grounds. Ability to complete and maintain mine certifications or safety training such as Mine Safety and Health Administration (MSHA) hazard training. Ability to obtain and maintain driver’s license and passport.

job_title: Finance Analyst, AWS AI and Machine Learning, AWS AI-ML Service Finance
job_Description: 3+ years of experience in finance or a related analytical field.  BA/BS in Finance, Accounting, Business, Economics, or a highly analytical field (e.g., Engineering, Math, and Computer Science) or equivalent and a minimum 3 years of experience in finance or a related analytical field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.  Job summary Come and be part of the Amazon AWS Artificial Intelligence finance team! We are a cloud AWS service that helps customers run machine learning algorithms on various Big Data systems in a scalable and cost-effective manner. With Machine Learning, businesses now ask our machines to do more than repetitive, strictly-defined tasks. We are taking it one step further and have begun to ask them to not only learn on their own but to also interpret data and report to the customer before they even knew they needed it. It's a step in history for you to be a part of. AWS Finance seeks a world class Finance Analyst to be a key member of its team. This position will serve as a key finance owner to support AI Verticals business.  Some key responsibilities will include:   Taking the lead in financial planning; building complex financial models and analytical tools to measure overall financial performance  Managing the AWS AI P&L and influencing business decisions that drive revenue and/or capital expenditures  Developing short and long range financial/operational forecasts  Developing and standardizing financial reports  Providing financial recommendations on a variety of investments, deal negotiations, new product launches and regional expansions as well as the capital expenditure planning for a new product/region roll-out.  Additional responsibilities include helping refine the capacity planning process and modeling improvements to help drive positive Free Cash Flow.  This role requires a self-starter with a strong financial modeling background, problem solving skills, a keen attention to detail, ability to work in a fast-paced environment with ambiguous situations, and solid skills in project management. This role has regular interaction with various business units across Amazon and requires strong people skills.   Advanced knowledge of Excel/ financial modeling  Advanced financial modeling skills, including knowledge of SQL  Strong interpersonal skills — including written and oral communication skills  An ability to meet tight deadlines and prioritize workload  An ability to develop new ideas and creative solutions  An ability to work independently and self-motivate in a fast-paced and rapidly-changing environment  Knowledge of cloud computing industry  Experience in a technology company or high-tech environment  Experience with TM1/Cognos or similar tools  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Machine Learning Manager
Job Description
OVERVIEW CoStar delivers real-time, verified real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence. Data Scientists at CoStar play an important role in this process, by mining data from sources including billions of pageviews, millions of images, vast geographic data, deep property content, and much more. We enhance our extensive property database, personalize our customers’ experience on our product websites, and create innovative datasets and forecasts that are the industry standards in our market leading products. We are searching for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our collaborative group that includes a mix of big data, API and full stack development teams. We are growing rapidly to help invent the future of Real Estate, with Data Science playing a critical role in that growth. RESPONSIBILITIES Collaborate on the continued improvement of CoStar’s cloud-based machine learning environment Design, build, test and deploy scalable, reusable and maintainable models that handle large amounts of data. Collaborate with other engineers, product owners, and leadership to create ML solutions that solve practical problems and improves our customer’s experience Gain an understanding of the CoStar business and how ML can improve things Basic Qualifications 8+ years of experience in software engineering designing and building data-intensive solutions using cloud computing 3+ years of experience in building and scaling Machine Learning platforms/pipelines 2+ years of experience leading teams developing ML solutions 3+ years of people management experience Preferred Qualifications Master's or doctoral degree in computer science, electrical engineering, mathematics, or a similar field 4+ years of on-the-job experience with an industry recognized Machine Learning framework such as as TensorFlow, Keras, and Scikit-learn Experience developing and deploying Machine Learning solutions in the cloud, ideally in AWS Ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly to a variety of audiences ML industry impact through conference presentations, papers, blog posts, open source contributions, or patents #LI-CH1
CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

Overview: Centurion is proud to be a leading provider of comprehensive healthcare services to correctional facilities, state hospitals, and community mental health centers nationwide.  We are currently seeking a  full-time  Senior Informatics Data Analyst  to join our Corporate Team.  This is a remote, work from home opportunity. Responsibilities: The  Senior Informatics Data Analyst  will lead the complex collection and storage of data from various business systems, applying technical skills to ensure the quality and accuracy of the data, and leading the process, design, and presentation of the data in ways to help the business make better decisions. This role also uses expertise to support less experienced team members, providing technical advice and project oversight as needed. Qualifications: Master’s degree in data analytics, informatics, public health, or a behavioral/mental health discipline Minimum of five years of experience as an informatics data analyst or related position Proficient in producing healthcare related technical and business documentation Proficient in producing client solutions for tracking business statistics or solving business problems Proficient knowledge of methodologies and processes for managing large-scale databases Proficient analytical skills Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks) Advanced knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc) Advanced Tableau skills Strong Understanding of meta-data standards Verbal and written communication skills and strong attention to detail Available Shift: Dayshift : Monday - Friday Benefits: We offer excellent compensation and comprehensive benefits for our full-time team members including: Health, dental, vision, disability and life insurance 401(k) with company match Generous paid time off Paid holidays Flexible Spending Account Continuing Education benefits Much more... About Us: Centurion Health contracts with state and local governments nationwide to provide comprehensive healthcare services to correctional facilities, state hospitals, and other community settings. Our dedication to making a difference and our passionate team of the best and the brightest healthcare employees has made us one of the leaders of the correctional health industry. Whether you are driven by purpose and impact or on a journey of professional growth, our opportunities can offer both.  :  indmhm #AF38

Applied Research Associates, Inc. is looking for candidates to join our Data Transformation of Foundational Military Intelligence (DTMI) team in Herndon, VA, where you will support our efforts to develop automated data decomposition algorithms and/or scripts that analyze data attributes to determine if more specific, operationally relevant relationships can be captured via data decomposition into separate parts such as detailing the day of the week as a separate, categorical value from the date and incorporate the results into business rules or a data model as appropriate. (aka ARA) is an employee-owned international research and engineering company known for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems in the physical sciences. job_title: Data Engineer - Asymmetric Threat Statistical Analyst
job_Description: Full Time Reston, United States  What You'll Get to Do: As an Asymmetric Threat Statistical Analyst, you will provide analytical support to our government client and forward deployed units. You will focus on countering improvised threats and the networks that finance, build, or employ such threats. Duties will include providing large-scale advanced analytics support; collecting, parsing, transforming, and integrating relevant data in support of projects; and providing operational, systems, and intelligence analysis to support the mission.  More About the Role: You will apply your expertise to provide data supporting strategic and operational requests from deployed and deploying units. These data may be used to: assist decision makers with risk assessments, prioritization, and/or to provide leadership with quantitative organizational assessments to support functional evaluations. You will develop, document, implement, and automate ETL (extract transform load) processes using SQL® and other analytical programming tools that most efficiently import structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data from new and/or dynamic data sources, ensuring data validity, reliability, and availability to users. You will collaborate with team members to ensure retrieval of information pertinent to current work and timely dissemination of counter asymmetric threat products.  You'll Bring These Qualifications:   Master's in a technical discipline plus three (3) years of experience; or Bachelor's in a technical field plus five (5) years of experience.  Significant programming experience in SQL® (including VBA, and macro).  Significant experience programming in at least one other programming language (Python, R, Perl, C++)  Current Top Secret/Specialized Compartmented Information Security Clearance.  The ability to effectively communicate both orally and in writing.   These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have:   SQL Certified Programmer certificate prior to employment.  Degree in one of the following disciplines: Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Statistics.  Experience using Python libraries including pandas, scipy, numpy, matplotlib, requests, or similar libraries in another programming language.  Knowledge of how to utilize business intelligence tools and processes that improve readability of and access to data, through the creation of stored/scheduled processes and effective visualization.  Ability to create complex programs that ingest, parse, clean, transform, and analyze large (millions of records) datasets; to apply mathematical and statistical models to real-world data, and; to deliver analytical results through written and oral presentations.  Prior experience utilizing ETL software (e.g., PowerCenter, Pentaho, PLSQL), Business Intelligence software (e.g., SAS® BI, Oracle BI, Cognos, Business Objects), or Geospatial Information Systems (GIS) software (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS® suite) is preferred.  Experience interacting with “big data” systems such as Hadoop or Amazon Web Services (AWS).  Experience using Alteryx Designer to build/manage workflows.  Prior experience as an all-source intelligence analyst or ORSA  Prior experience with Counter UAS operations.

Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design  Bachelor's degree in computer science related fields OR 1+ years equivalent experience in software development  7+ years experience in hands-on server-side development  Expertise in concurrent programming, and JVM based languages like Java/Scala  Proven experience in architecting, building and delivering large-scale highly available and fault-tolerant distributed systems  Strong communicator - ability to adapt verbal, written communication to audience  Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field  Amazon Personalize is a deep learning AWS Service that makes it easy for developers to create individualized recommendations for customers. We're building a large-scale machine learning platform and are looking for senior technical leaders to architect and develop the platform. If you're passionate about large-scale data systems, and have prior experience in solving problems of consistency, availability and building large scale distributes systems, enjoy extracting maximum performance at every layer of the stack, let's talk. You'll collaborate with product managers and scientists to rapidly deliver production ready machine learning solutions that have a broad business impact. This is a unique opportunity to join a fast-growing startup within AWS AI, where you'll be working on cutting edge technology, influence and shape the technology, product and business. Inclusive Team Culture Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Work/Life Balance Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives. Mentorship & Career Growth Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.   Excellent leadership skills and ability to lead and influence technical direction, and best practices  Experience designing and implementing low latency systems  Exposure to AWS Cloud computing would be a plus  MS or PhD in computer science or related field  Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

The AI SGO works to capitalize on Deloitte's shared strengths, leverage our scale and define our unique, highly differentiated formula for market leadership. This role is for a full-time AI SGO Senior Consultant who will play a core strategic support role across priority programs.   Work You'll Do:   This role will play a critical role in supporting a variety of strategic initiatives aimed at creating sustainable value and competitive advantage for the firm through AI. Representative responsivities include:  AI Go-to-Market Support (GTM) Support efforts to drive AI GTM leader engagement and support incubation of AI offerings across priority sectors and domains, including strategy support and execution Support ongoing pursuit activities, including efforts to identify pipeline opportunities that leverage Deloitte's unique capabilities and infrastructure in data and AI Help drive cross-business GTM activation of strategic AI-enabled offerings Data and AI Learning and Development Support Help shape the future of AI training by supporting efforts to drive impactful collateral that can be used both internally and externally to amplify Deloitte's AI messaging Curate impactful stories across the firm on where and how AI is delivering value Be a champion in the organization for the power of AI and the impact it will bring Provide ad-hoc support across other priority AI SGO initiatives on as-needed basis Required: Bachelor's degree Minimum of 4 years of experience leading strategy within a consulting firm or similar organization Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future Limited travel (while up to 10% of travel may be necessary for the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice) Preferred:  We are seeking a resource Able to tell a compelling business story through analysis Ability to adapt quickly to changing business environment Strong planning and organizational skills with great attention to detail job_title: Data Engineer - Data Pipelines & Data Science Platforms
job_Description: Job Description Panjiva is a data-driven technology company that uses machine learning to provide powerful search, analysis, and visualization of billions of shipping records from nearly every country in the world. More than 3,000 customers in over 100 countries, ranging from Fortune 500 companies and startups to government agencies and hedge funds, rely on our platform for supply chain intelligence. In global trade, better insight means better decision making and stronger connections between companies and governments across the globe. Recognizing Panjiva’s cutting-edge technology, S&P Global acquired Panjiva in 2018. This acquisition has grown our resources, dramatically expanded our access to data, and accelerated our growth plans. People are Panjiva’s greatest strength – join our engineering team as we map out a key part of the world economy! Job Description As a data engineer on our team, you will play a key role in developing our next-generation data science infrastructure and underlying core technologies. You will work with Panjiva’s world-class data scientists, analysts, and engineers to create products that solve important real-world business problems in a collaborative, fast-paced, and fun environment. You’ll work closely with our data science team to develop new platforms, infrastructure, and tools that will allow for machine learning applications at production scale over ever-growing datasets. You’ll design and leverage distributed computing technologies, data schemas, and APIs to construct data science pipelines. In addition, you’ll be expected to participate in augmenting our infrastructure to seamlessly integrate new data sets through constant R&D of the technologies and systems we use. Join us in building the next generation of products as we continue to deliver valuable and actionable insights to decision-makers in the $15 trillion global trade industry. Responsibilities Architect and implement distributed systems that perform complex transformations, processing, and analysis over very large scale datasets Develop processes to monitor and automate detection of quality regressions in raw data or in the output of Panjiva’s machine learning models Working with our data scientists to turn large-scale messy, diverse, and often unstructured data into a source of meaningful insights for our customers Optimizing slow-running database queries and data pipelines Helping enhance our search engine, capable of running sophisticated user queries quickly and efficiently Building internal tools and backend services to enable our data scientists and product engineers to improve efficiency  Compensation/Benefits Information: S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $68,300 to $155,900 . Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location. This role is eligible to receive S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires . Qualifications B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science (or a related field) or equivalent work experience 3+ years of experience working with data-at-scale in a production environment Experience designing and implementing large-scale, distributed systems Experience in multi-threaded software development (or some form of parallelism) Significant performance engineering experience (e.g., profiling slow code, understanding complicated query plans, etc.) Solid understanding of core algorithms and data structures, including the ability to select (and apply) the optimal ones to computationally expensive operations over data-at-scale Strong understanding of relational databases and proficiency with SQL Deep knowledge of at least one scripting language (e.g., Python, Ruby, JavaScript) Deep knowledge of at least one compiled language (e.g., Scala, C++, Java, Go) Experience developing software on Linux-based operating systems Experience with distributed version control systems Nice-to-Haves Familiarity with relational database internals (especially PostgreSQL) Proficiency with cloud computing platforms, specifically AWS Working knowledge of probability & statistics Contributions to open-source software Experience building customer-centric products  Grade ( relevant for internal applicants only ):  11 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, sex, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment. If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person. The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. 20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), IFTECH202.1 - Middle Professional Tier I (EEO Job Group), SWP Priority – Ratings - (Strategic Workforce Planning)  Job ID:  266145 Posted On:  2022-01-13 Location:  Cambridge, Massachusetts, United States

PointClickCare is the leading North American cloud-based healthcare software for the acute and long-term and post-acute care markets. For over 20 years, the company has held the same vision – to help the world care for vulnerable populations. Since its inception, PointClickCare has grown exponentially with over 1,700 employees today all working towards impacting the lives of millions. Recognized by Forbes as one of the Top 100 Private Cloud Companies and acknowledged by Waterstone Human Capital as Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture,   PointClickCare leads the way in creating cloud-based software. With its recent acquisition of Collective Medical, PointClickCare solidifies its position as a high growth healthcare software provider, serving over 21,000 long-term and post-acute care providers and over 1,300 hospitals. Their shared mission to support vulnerable populations is allowing PointClickCare and Collective Medical to connect disparate points of care at scale faster than anyone else in the market. For more information on PointClickCare, please connect with us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn. *this position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship* The Role: Collective Medical seeks a Senior Data Analyst with strong healthcare data experience. You will be part of a team focused on analysis, monitoring and continual improvement of data quality within the Collective Medical network. The network includes patient visits and clinical data from hundreds of health systems and payers nationally, including 3B+ inbound and 150M+ outbound transactions annually. The team’s focus includes data ingested by, data sent by and the configuration of the Collective Medical platform. Responsibilities include:  Clearly understand and address requests from internal and external stakeholders, including guiding stakeholders on their best options  Develop analyses to best support stakeholder needs, using both raw and curated data  Communicate the results of analysis to stakeholders, through multiple mediums. These include easy to understand visualizations, presentations, and verbal and written communication.  Create and maintain dashboards and other reporting components to support our stakeholders and business needs  Ensure accurate quality for deliverables by working with peers for appropriate levels of quality assurance Who you’ll work with:  The Data Quality team: your immediate team of data analysts and data engineers  The Customer Success team: represents our customers and their long-term data needs  The Integration team: the subject matter experts in the data we ingest and send  The Data Science team: colleagues who we collaborate with on projects and who share a passion for data Skills and experience we seek: The ideal candidate will demonstrate the ability to go beyond providing raw results and to provide guidance to a variety of stakeholders in conjunction with their analyses.    Bachelor’s degree in statistics, data science or informatics. Master’s degree or PhD in a quantitative field is a plus.  5+ years’ professional experience in data analysis, data science or research with healthcare data  Proficiency in data analysis tools, e.g., R, SAS or Python  Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI  Proficiency in querying SQL databases, including writing complex queries. Proficiency in query performance optimization is a plus. Position Responsibilities: Postdoctoral position in Psychiatric Genetics and Machine Learning (ML) of major depression disorder (MDD) and alcohol use disorders (AUD). The Virginia Institute for Psychiatric and Behavioral Genetics (VIPBG) of Virginia Commonwealth University is hiring a 2-year term postdoctoral researcher as early as January 2022. VIPBG offers a rich multidisciplinary training environment in molecular and statistical genetics, epidemiology, psychology, and psychiatry. Training is tailored to the experience and needs of the fellow, and has an emphasis on collaborative research. The primary research aim of this fellowship is to leverage large-scale genetic and biobank data to advance the understanding of risk factors for psychiatric disorders including major depression and alcohol use disorder. We are seeking a data scientist with an interest in applying statistical genetics and machine learning to large-scale genetic studies. Strong candidates will have excellent programming and data analytic skills, knowledge of statistics, familiarity with genome informatics tools, and a strong publication record. Statistical genetics experience and/or expertise in machine learning methods is preferred, but interested applicants are encouraged to apply regardless of past training experiences. The appointed researcher will work full-time on the development and implementation of computational models, and their interpretation. The fellow will take advantage of large sets of genomic, clinical, and behavioral data derived from a wide variety of large-scale studies. We have world class collaborations locally, nationally, and abroad to support a rich training experience. Current projects include analyses conducted in the context of international consortia: UK Biobank, Psychiatric Genomics Consortium, and Lifelines. The research fellow will contribute to NIH funded research projects including adapting machine learning methods to estimate risk to strictly defined major depression in large-scale biobanks samples that measure many variables but may not contain rigorous clinical assessments and use these predictions to discover additional genetic variation specifically influencing major depression. The fellow will also be invited to join the VCU Alcohol Research Center P50 project that investigates the genetic architecture of Alcohol Use Disorder by leveraging cross-trait genetic correlations and next generation sequencing studies. The appointed fellow will be mentored by a multidisciplinary team involving leaders in human genetics (Drs. Peterson & Webb), psychiatry (Dr. Kendler), and mathematical statistics/statistical genetics (Dr. Bacanu). The successful candidate will write as first author at least 3 integrative papers. First, using comorbid disorders to increase the accuracy of rare variant signal detection in AUD. Second, Using ML to increase the accuracy of MDD status in biobanks. Third, using both comorbid disorders and ML prediction to increase the accuracy of common and rare variant signal detection in MDD. Please note that international students, minorities, women, and other protected individuals are particularly encouraged to apply. VCU is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Contact: Email: roseann.peterson@vcuhealth.org Web: https://vipbg.vcu.edu/, https://www.pop-gem-lab.com/  Required Qualifications: (1) A PhD in a relevant field - statistical/human/psychiatric genetics, mathematics/statistics/biostatistics, computer science/programming, or similar (2) Ability to work collaboratively and as part of a team (3) A commitment to thorough, rigorous research, and a thoughtful approach to problem solving. (4) A strong background in data science programming languages such as R and UNIX   Preferred Qualifications: Previous experience with genetic data, Experience applying machine learning to large datasets, Experience with high performance computing, Experience with cloud computing, Demonstration of reproducible research tools (e.g., GitHub)Strong publication record Salary Range: $53,760-$65,292 Position Details: Department: Psychiatry/VIPBG  Employment Type: PD - Post Doc  Restricted Status: Yes  FTE: 100  Exemption Status: Exempt Contact Information: Contact Name: Lori Pfister Contact Email: lori.pfister@vcuhealth.org

Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Top Secret SCI w/Polygraph Job Description: Parsons is looking for a sharp Expert Level Data Architect to join our growing Space and Geospatial Solutions team. This data architect is an individual who is responsible for designing, creating, deploying, and managing data architecture for our mission-critical DoD efforts. You will define how the data will be stored, consumed, integrated, and managed by different data entities and IT systems, as well as any applications using or processing that data in some way. This data architect enforces/assists in enforcing adherence to GEOINT data standards, and assures data assets are in line with the defined GEOINT data architecture.   Duties include: Support the Warfighter Support Office efforts to bring the latest relevant datasets to the warfighters’ mission(s). Implement/integrate data/content architecture with Odyssey data architecture. Coordinate with Chief Engineer, Lead Data engineer, Mission Tradecraft developer(s), data owners and capabilities engineers to determine warfighters mission needs and the interoperability with warfighter mission systems and applications. Coordinate with multiple DoD systems entities, including (but not limited to) Open Data Store (ODS), OCONUS Data Center (ODC), NSG Consolidated Libraries (NCL), Gateway, GRiD, and IC GIS Portal. Coordinate with Warfighter Support Office deployed Capabilities Leads, GEOINT Expeditionary (GEO-X) Embeds, NSG Data owners and Data Corps. Design and deliver operations research applications (databases, websites, tools, and products) that are geospatially enabled to support a multitude of intelligence issues. Incorporate the latest methodologies such Big Data, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), Data Harvesting and Content Curation to modernize the Warfighter Support Office's data pipeline. Develop automation to streamline GA and IA processes to improve consistency, quality and availability of GEOINT content across multiple security domains. Support cross domain data transfer. Develop PL/SQL, stored procedures, and extract, transform, load (ETL) scripts to support this analytics application. Must be familiar with Continuous Integration & Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) best practices for code build and deployments, DevOPS, SAFe AGILE, and/or any DoD sponsored agile methodologies. Document database design and develop optimum data ingest techniques from multiple data sources. Required Skills & Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, GIS, Management Information Systems, Engineering, or related STEM degree. Minimum experience of 5 years with relational databases such as Oracle, SQL Server, Sybase, RedShift. Minimum 3+ years of experience with ETL technologies. Senior-level experience in cloud-based data architecting, with emphasis on implementing content delivery network (CDN) solutions in disconnected, disadvantaged, intermittent and/or low bandwidth (DDIL) mission environments. Senior-level experience in securely and efficiently moving data and operating across hybrid multi-cloud and on premise and multi-fabric environments – within enclaves on the same security domain, and across security domains. Demonstrated experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) Commercial Cloud Services (C2S) ecosystem, including AWS Database solutions. Senior-level experience with the unique networking aspects of cloud computing, including low latency within the data center, and higher latency and limited bandwidth for remote users. Demonstrated familiarity with NSG data standards. Desired Skills & Qualifications: Master’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, GIS, Management Information Systems, Engineering, or related STEM degree. Information technology course/certification in one or more of the following areas (or other relevant areas): Amazon Web Services (AWS) Certified Solutions Architect, Amazon Web Services (AWS) Certified Big Data – Specialty, Cloudera Certified Professional (CCP): Data Engineer, Data Science Council of America (DASCA) Associate Big Data Engineer, Data Science Council of America (DASCA) Senior Big Data Engineer, Google Professional Data Engineer, HDP Apache Spark Developer, IBM Certified Data Architect – Big Data, IBM Certified Data Engineer – Big Data, USGIF Certified GEOINT Professional- Essentials (CGP-E), GIS & Analysis Tools (CGP-G), Geospatial Data Management (CGP-D) Demonstrated experience with cloud technologies, hybrid cloud implementation strategies, data center networks, Software Defined Networking (SDN), and/or Network Function Virtualization (NFV). Demonstrated experience with programming techniques, using HTML 5/Javascript, ArcObjects, Python, Model Builder, Oracle, SQL, GIScience, Geospatial Analysis, Statics, ArcGIS Desktop, ArcGIS Server, Arc SDE, ArcIMS, SPSS, and SAS. Demonstrated experience with ArcGIS templates, manage ArcGIS Portals, and customize ESRI StoryMap Templates. Demonstrated experience with the Odyssey Technology Applications Stack (PIXIA, iSpy, ArcGIS Portal, Google Earth Enterprise Platform, GEOAxIS). Must be able to obtain, maintain and/or currently possess a security clearance. The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by federal, state, provincial or local mandates or customer requirements.

Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us. MITRE’s newly established AI Security and Perception Department within the Artificial Intelligence and Autonomy Innovation Center consists of a multi-generational, diverse team united by a passion and a sense of urgency to harness AI to help solve problems in the public interest. We discover, create, lead through empowering an inclusive community of collaborative innovators, learners, and technical creatives. We’re looking for people with a lifelong commitment to learning, who are passionate about harnessing artificial intelligence to make a positive impact in the world. We’ve built a supportive and inclusive environment where collaboration is encouraged, and learning is shared freely. We value our diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds, and perspectives and harness these qualities to discover connections, solve problems, and create extraordinary impact. As a Senior Artificial Intelligence Engineer, you will: Be part of a team developing and implementing AI algorithms to help address critical national and global challenges like global health, climate change and national security Develop and use modern software engineering techniques to develop AI-related software Maintain knowledge of advances of AI capabilities in industry and academia Evaluate AI solutions and compare to sponsor requirements and needs Contribute to the technical work program of one or more projects and produce quality products focused on successful sponsor outcomes Provide thought leadership and collaborate with academic and industry partners Provide exemplary leadership, caring mentorship, and collaborative technical advice to staff Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Cybersecurity, or related technical field Must be a U.S. citizen with ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance 3+ years’ work experience in machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, statistics, and/or related fields Hands-on experience using tools such as: C/C++, Python, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, dlib, and database languages Outstanding written and oral presentation skills are required for both internal and sponsor-facing communications Preferred Qualifications: Advanced degree in related field of study Candidates that possess a current/active US Government clearance are preferred Proven experience with Statistical Methods, Neural Networks, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Data Science, Privacy, Trust & Safety, Software Engineering or similar This requisition requires the candidate to have a minimum of the following clearance(s): This requisition requires the hired candidate to have or obtain, within one year from the date of hire, the following clearance(s): MITRE requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. 7+ years of business development, product management, management consulting, strategic partnerships, or enterprise sales experience.  Experience developing and executing on GTM strategies that are large in scope.  Working knowledge of one or more ML Frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow) and ML methods including NLP models (BERT, GPT-2/3), computer vision-based models (object detection, image recognition), and text-based models (Seq2Seq, Topic modeling).  Experience interfacing with customers (Enterprise, SMB, and Startups) and ability to convert customer requirements to high level architecture solutions to build on.  Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight that drives customer adoption and recommendations to the business.  Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must. Experience speaking at technology conferences, as well as communicating across the organization from technical staff to VP/CxOs.  Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations is key in a matrix environment.  Business and/or technical degree required  Job summary Are you passionate about developing impactful Machine Learning (ML), novel and rigorous engineering strategy? Are you passionate about engaging the AI/ML community (AI researchers, developers, data scientists, data engineers, and innovative entrepreneurs in hot startups and large enterprises)? Artificial Intelligence (AI) has the potential to transform our society and community for generations. Impacting transportation, mobility, telecommunication, energy, healthcare and insurance, hospitality, assistance to the elderly and disabled. Achieving this requires implementing complex computing systems that we entrust with assisting humans. AWS is taking a fresh approach in providing an end-to-end, scalable cloud environment that simplifies the development and deployment of AI/ML technology. Including a global cloud footprint, infinitely scalable cloud storage, advanced networking and security, state-of-the-art AI platforms and services, rigorous engineering, and a team with the longest experience building cloud technologies. We are looking for an experienced and motivated candidate for the role of Principal Business Development for AI/ML Frameworks. In this role, you will be responsible for defining, building, and deploying targeted strategies to accelerate customer adoption of key ML Frameworks and the AWS ML solution stack. In this role, you will work closely with customers to understand the infrastructural requirements, complexities involved in scaling ML applications across use-cases like natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision that take advantage of the power of AWS’ storage, compute, networking, and ML technologies. You will have the opportunity to define go-to-market (GTM) strategies and lead cross-functional initiatives to expand existing markets, develop scalable programs to drive adoption, and identify new opportunities. This involves activities include market sizing, building an opportunity pipeline, working with customers to understand technical requirements for proof-of-concepts, creating content to train the field teams, driving industry thought-leadership, working with product teams to define new features, and identifying partners and potential acquisitions. As the ideal candidate, you possess a business and technology background that enables you to lead and drive engagements with startups and large enterprises. You have domain expertise in key ML use cases (e.g., NLP, computer vision), understand the challenges involved in training and deploying models, MLOps, orchestrating workloads using containers, and are able to work backwards from customer requirements to suggest scalable solutions and architectures. You have the technical depth to articulate the benefits of ML Frameworks and AWS services to data scientists, data engineers, and C-Level executives. In addition, you have a good understanding of the AI/ML market trends, ecosystem, opportunities, and are passionate about market development and evangelism of ML Frameworks and AWS ML solutions. You will need to be adept at interacting, communicating, and partnering with teams within AWS (product, solutions architecture, sales, marketing, and professional services) and externally with customers, partners, and importantly, the developer community of ML Frameworks and key open-source offerings. You will be responsible for creating compelling content, and building scalable programs and mechanisms to increase awareness and adoption of ML Frameworks and AWS solutions. Additionally, you will work with the AWS ML and EC2 product teams to shape product vision and prioritize features for AI/ML Frameworks and applications. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and being scrappy is a must. About AWS Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 2000 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, and technology. AWS customers are looking for ways to transform their businesses and solve their own complex business challenges with ML technologies in the cloud. AWS is leading the way in providing customers with powerful, end-to-end ML platforms such as Amazon SageMaker.  Roles & Responsibilities:   Develop and execute go-to-market strategies focusing on AI/ML Frameworks and AWS ML solutions and technologies to target key workloads like NLP and computer vision.  Lead senior level customer meetings to discuss business and technical challenges and explore how AWS can help address them.  Define, build, and launch startups and enterprise focused campaigns around deploying successful ML architectures on AWS.  Collaborate effectively with ML solution architects and experts to develop scalable architectures and end-end solutions to solve key customer challenges.  Serve as an evangelist for AI/ML Frameworks (e.g., PyTorch on AWS), engage closely with customers, the developer community, and key partners.  Develop market intelligence frameworks to identify market trends, use cases, choice of tools and architectures, and partners.  Develop content (e.g., blogs, whitepapers, case studies), lead workshops / hackathons, and represent AWS at key AI/ML conferences.  Train and enable the AWS field teams on the value propositions of key ML Frameworks and AWS solutions and technologies. This would include developing sales plays, targeted campaigns, an enabling the field to uncover and drive ML opportunities.  Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. Experience developing, deploying and managing AI products at scale.  Experience writing technical articles, speaking at technology conferences, and contributing to open source.  Experience managing and deploying ML products.  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.
