Physical Demands Employee needs to be able to sit at a workstation for extended periods; use hand(s) to handle or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. Most positions require ability to work on desktop or laptop computer for extended periods of time reading, reviewing/analyzing information, and providing recommendations, summaries and/or reports in written format. Must be able to effectively communicate with others verbally and in writing. Employee may be required to occasionally lift and/or move moderate amounts of weight, typically less than 20 pounds. Regular and predictable attendance is essential.

Founded in 2005 by supply chain risk management expert Jennifer Bisceglie, we have grown into the largest and most influential player in the emerging operational resilience space. This past July we achieved $100 million dollars in Series C funding led by the investment firm Night Dragon, with additional participation from Series A and B investors Kleiner Perkins and Venrock. This latest round of funding brings Interos' valuation to $1billion, earning us unicorn status.  Based in Arlington, Va., Interos' breakthrough SaaS platform leverages artificial intelligence and machine learning to model the entire business ecosystems of companies into a living global map. Users can drill down to any single supplier, anywhere – helping businesses and government organizations reduce risk, avoid operational disruptions, and achieve dramatically superior resilience and performance. We have seen hypergrowth in the past 3 years and continue to expand our team across the US and several countries in Europe.  The Opportunity:  You want to solve problems you can't just Google answers for. You want to deal with real big data in real products that real people. You want exposure to cutting edge tech including real machine learning at scale, graph databases, and predictive modeling. And you want it all in a high-growth startup.  Join the close-knit engineer team at Interos that conceptualizes and develops our industry-leading data-driven Interos Knowledge Graph. Hone your skills in an agile, test-driven environment and have a measurable impact on a well-established rapidly expanding business.  At Interos, Senior Data Software Engineers have a deep understanding of Data Modeling, Python fundamentals and architecture. They consistently deliver large features that provide significant value to our customers. Senior Engineers regularly review large sections of our product, making sure things don't 'fall through the cracks'. They collaborate well with others, seek input from teammates, and provide detailed code reviews.  Essential Functions/duties:   Assume responsibility for key parts of the Interos Knowledge Graph architecture.  Translate Data Science experimental code into tested, production ready modules.  Create connectors for ingesting data from third party databases, APIs, and web sites.  Optimize data structures, improve code execution, and reduce memory consumption of existing implementation.  Develop JSON APIs and micro.   Technology We Use:   We build architecture with Python.  We use Elasticsearch for search.  We use Prefect for Dataflow Automation.  We use Kafka for Event Streaming.  We use Kubernetes for deployment.  We use Postgres & Snowflake for our persistent storage.  We use Databricks for ML prototyping.  We use AWS for our infrastructure.  We develop against services in the cloud.  We keep our projects up-to-date with current versions.   Qualifications:   6+ years of experience in Software Development.  3+ years of full-time professional Python experience including production experience with data pipelines.  A seasoned engineer who enjoys sharing your experience with the team.  Passionate about writing code that is scalable, maintainable, reusable, and well-tested.  Interested in building reliable, fault-tolerant, production-grade systems.  Feel comfortable debugging large applications and refactoring them to well-tested components and services.  Have experience designing, implementing, and maintaining APIs as a service for your team and customers.  Comfortable interacting with a range of audiences (technical and business stakeholders).  Have experience in an agile environment.  Enjoy optimizing complex data models for comprehension and performance.  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or closely related field or a foreign equivalent.   Additional Information:   Supervisory Responsibility: This position has no supervisory responsibilities.  Travel Requirements: This position may require up to 10% travel. Frequently travel is outside the local area and overnight.  Work Environment: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, printers.  Physical Demands: This is largely a sedentary role. Physical requirements include occasional lifting/carrying of 5 pounds; visual acuity, speech and hearing; hand and eye coordination and manual dexterity necessary to operate a computer keyboard and basic office equipment. Subject to sitting, standing, reaching, walking, twisting, and kneeling to perform the essential functions. Working conditions are primarily inside an office environment.  Colorado Only: The range provided is for Colorado-based hires only and will be commensurate with candidate experience. Pay ranges for candidates in other locations other than CO may differ based on the cost of labor in that location. Pay range: $95,257 - $110,210.  FLSA Status: Exempt   Vaccination Requirement:  Interos is required to comply with  Federal Executive Order 14042  mandating employees be vaccinated against COVID-19. All Interos employees must be fully vaccinated* against COVID-19, unless you have a legally valid medical or religious reason. Any requests for exemptions based on medical or sincerely held religious beliefs will be evaluated confidentially by our Chief People Officer after hiring.  Fully vaccinated means an individual must have received their second dose of the Moderna or Pfizer vaccine or the single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine.  Benefits:   Comprehensive Health & Wellness package (Medical, Dental and Vision)  10 Paid Holiday Days Off  Flexible Paid Time Off (FTO)  Pet Insurance  401 (k) Employer Matching  Stock Options  Family Planning reimbursement  Legal Insurance  Identity Theft Protection  Child Tutoring Reimbursement  Career advancement opportunities  Casual Dress  On-site gym and dedicated Peloton room at headquarters  Company Events (Sports Games, Fitness Competitions, Birthday Celebrations, Contests, Happy Hours)  Annual company party  Employee Referral Program   Interos is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other classification protected by law.  If you are a candidate in need of assistance or an accommodation in the application process, please contact hr@interos.ai

For further consideration please contact Andrew Lombardi - Andrew.Lombardi@KornFerry.com  Sentara Healthcare is seeking an innovative, entrepreneurial-minded leader with a deep technology background to lead the enterprise data team, governance, and strategy. This opportunity allows for a seasoned executive to join one of the premier health systems in the country. Directly reporting to Tim Skeen, Senior Vice President and Chief Information Officer of Sentara Healthcare, the new Vice President, Chief Data Officer (“CDO”) will be a crucial change agent in the company’s strategy to leverage internal and external data assets to fuel data applications and advanced analytics. Data and the ability to perform advanced analytics using data are key to supporting the needed changes in the healthcare ecosystem.  This individual will: > Lead data strategy and governance. > Create and drive the enterprise data architecture and roadmap. > Assess and optimize Sentara’s Information Lifecycle. > Build an overarching data and tools ecosystem to support advanced analytics, and interoperability internally and externally. > Lead a 24x7x365 data and analytics operational environment and the teams involved in managing and operating the data infrastructure.  The CDO be a key asset and change agent in the company’s continued transformation towards a consumer health solutions organization by guiding, inspiring, and building a “best in class” data platform for the communities we serve. As a trusted advisor to the executive team, this individual will lead the development of the data strategy, roadmap, and execution, transforming provider, customer, patient, and member engagement through data, and the enablement of advanced analytics. This leader will oversee and optimize both data and analytic platforms that deliver valuable solutions for a range of end-users to ensure that business objectives are achieved more efficiently and effectively across Sentara’s health plan (Optima) and care delivery network. The Chief Data Officer will be a strong cross-functional leader who can liaise with other C-suite executives and work harmoniously with different business verticals to orchestrate a federated approach to data and analytic platforms. The selected person should have deep experience with aligning multiple stakeholders, generating enthusiasm and endorsement from leadership teams, and broadening our workforce understanding towards organizational change. She/he will be a motivating and respected leader across all levels of the organization and play an integral role in managing our best-in-class teams.  Key Responsibilities The Chief Data Officer will have a broad set of responsibilities, including: > Create and establish a strategy and vision that shapes and drives data and supports analytics to enable the company to function more efficiently. Identify growth opportunities, mitigate financial risk, identify business cost savings opportunities, and ensure that data can be appropriately accessed and consumed across the company. > Develop a scalable data architecture that supports the transformation of Sentara to a digital, analytically driven organization. This includes ensuring data is available for enterprise applications, digital consumer-facing applications, analytic applications, as well as for the clinical research and the community of analytic professionals that execute reporting, analytics, and advanced analytics for the enterprise. > Develop, drive, and execute the long-term vision and strategy for the data and platforms that enable advanced analytics by working with multiple teams and stakeholders across the company. Creates value by unlocking and sharing data, and information in ways which will spur innovation. > Partner with the VP, Enterprise Analytics to introduce automation, artificial intelligence, and predictive learning initiatives that drive the future of sustainable and quality healthcare delivery. Additionally, work to expand current data governance processes and establish a comprehensive data governance program. > Assume primary responsibility for driving core data governance processes including data standards, data quality, and metadata management that ensure the completeness, accuracy, consistency, validity & uniqueness of enterprise data, as well as the architecture and operational processes that ensure data is accessible, timely, and fit for use. Effectively manages risk associated with the use of data. Strive to reduce the cost of managing data and increase the value of the data. > Work with business and IT leaders to identify areas of technical needs for future data science capabilities. Drives the development and deployment of the data and advanced analytics platform. Identifies and manages the prioritization of business projects and enterprise data initiatives. > Develop a deep understanding of the lines of business Portfolio and Products’ needs and priorities and work closely with each business to identify solutions that align with the enterprise strategy, leveraging enterprise solutions, and when needed provides specific solutions that are unique for that business.  > Lead, manage, and partner with cross functional teams to continually improve data governance, data quality, and data security in a multi-tenant environment; standardize data quality measurements by establishing metrics, building tools, and processes. > Serve as an advisor and consultant to business leaders across the enterprise; has strong ability to influence, thought partnership(s), and collaborate with executive leaders, technology leaders, and partners, business stakeholders and their respective team(s). > Promote and lead a culture of operational excellence and continuous improvement for the daily support of data and analytics platforms and constantly evolve and transform based on the enterprise needs. > Develop, coach, and lead a high performing team, and manage a diverse team of professionals that focuses on maximizing performance, business impact and results, as well as career development and succession plan(s). > Maintain an understanding of new and emerging technology trends, and an awareness of innovative techniques and companies. > Collaborate with industry data experts to understand emergent approaches to data management and platform development in the support of digital platforms, analytic platforms, and research platforms. > Recommends and pursues collaborations and provides appropriate technical guidance to ensure the success of such collaborations.  Education Level An undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, MIS, or an appropriate discipline is required. An advanced degree in Information Systems or a related field is preferred.  Experience The Chief Data Officer will be a technology leader with at least 10 years of broadly based, progressive information management and data strategy experience, ideally within healthcare. Proven leadership and management skills are paramount, and the successful candidate must clearly demonstrate the ability to create, lead and execute a vision for an enterprise data function. The successful candidate must possess significant experience and expertise in modern, cloud-based platforms and tools, preferably Azure. One’s experience should also include leading an organization on the challenging journey from legacy, on-prem tools to modern cloud-enabled capabilities.  License None, unless noted in the "Other" section below  Skills Required:  Preferred: None, unless noted in the "Other" section below  Other   At least 10 years of progressively responsible relevant experience in data management, including creating partnerships, implementing data governance, and understanding the underlying technologies needed to enable data innovation across a midsized or large organization.  Demonstrated experience in building and managing technical platforms that support analytics, including platforms that support machine learning and AI driven approaches to predictive and prescriptive modeling.  Experience in computer programming, query languages, and data visualization platforms such as Tableau, and advanced analytic ecosystems that enable the productionalization and automation of AI & ML-driven predictive and prescriptive models preferred.  Demonstrated experience with developing data strategy, policies, and procedures, as well as successfully executing programs that meet or exceed expectations in a dynamic environment; experience creating tools and capabilities to assist with data discovery, and collaboration, ensure data quality, and to load, clean, enrich, manage, and share data and metadata from a variety of sources.  Ability to effectively drive business, culture, and technology change in a dynamic, and complex operating environment.  Ability to effectively coordinate, allocate, and manage resources and projects throughout multiple teams.  Knowledge of trends, and developments in the fields of data management and analytic platforms. Information management, and quantitative skills, including working knowledge of IT infrastructure, various technologies/platforms, and enterprise-specific vendor solutions.  Industry-specific knowledge of data security protocols, policies, and regulations. Exemplary diplomatic skills, and ability to help senior business leaders see value, opportunities, and risks beyond their own area of expertise.  Ability to understand problems from a broad perspective, and anticipate the impact of administrative issues, and solutions.  Proven experience as a thought leader and innovator in the development of new tools, methodologies, and problem-solving approaches; including but not limited to experience with cloud, big data and enabling machine learning and artificial intelligence.  Deep experience in data architecture, data governance, warehousing, quality processes, and implementation. Skilled in structuring fact and dimension tables, leading logical and physical database design, data modeling, reporting metadata and ETL processes.  Ability to balance strategic development and day-to-day operation responsibilities Superb track record of change management and driving change in a large, complex organization; strong interpersonal skills with demonstrated success in driving change and alignment on an organizational and interpersonal level; experience integrating teams across multiple business units.  Energized by the opportunity to work with Sentara’s leadership, reporting, and technology teams to drive institutional change in the way the organization engages with its providers, patients, and customers  An understanding of healthcare globally, underlying markets, and key market drivers, global megatrends including data governance in other industries, and the value of data in acting on external disruption and market trends  Software engineering expertise including experience with SAFE Agile Methodology and Portfolio Management.  Exceptional analytical, written, oral, and presentation skills with proven track record of effectively communicating actionable insights.  Excellent communication skills of an executive who excels in communicating in a variety of formal and informal presentation settings, large and small, both inside and outside the organization, and issuing cogent and consistent messages that build confidence and achieve desired outcomes  Excellent problem solving and negotiating skills.

Introduction As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.   Your Role and Responsibilities Research, development, integration and implementation of AI model for a variety of technology transformation project deliverables.   Required Technical and Professional Expertise  At least 1 year of experience designing and developing technology solutions and strategy Strong engineering background, preferred in fields such as Computer Science or Computer Engineering Proficiency with programming languages such as Python, Java, or similar languages Familiarity with data structures, algorithms, storage systems, and other technical tools Familiarity with machine learning models and deep learning technologies (Keras, Tensorflow, PyTorch) Experience researching and architecting novel AI approaches, including anomaly detection models Experience deploying full-stack solutions, with knowledge of environment, processing, and runtime requirements Ability to translate client mission to technical decisions Understanding of how technical decisions impact end user experience Ability to work effectively and independently in a team of technical individuals Ability to translate technical work to client deliverables and high-level presentations  Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise  N/A U.S. Citizenship Required United States - DoD Secret Clearance  About Business Unit IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.  This job requires you to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated prior to your start date, where legally permissible. Proof of vaccination status will be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical, pregnancy or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.  Your Life @ IBM Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.  Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.  It's time to define your career.  About IBM IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.  Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.  At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.  Location Statement IBM offers a wide range of resources for eligible IBMers to thrive both inside and outside of work. In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to:   12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Family care options are also available to support eligible employees during COVID-19. World-class training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform. IBM's learning culture supports your restless attitude to grow your skills and build the depth and scale of knowledge needed to achieve your career goals. Well-being programs to support mental and physical health. Financial programs that empower you to plan, save, and manage your money (including expert financial counseling, 401(k), IBM stock discount, etc.). Select educational reimbursement opportunities. Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups where you can network and connect with IBMers across the globe. Giving and volunteer programs to benefit charitable organizations and local communities. Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.  US Citizenship Required.  Being You @ IBM IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

When you join Verizon  Verizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We're a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here. What you’ll be doing...  As a Data Operations Engineer, you'll handle end to end data operations. You will be responsible for classification and data provision work including classifying data, securing data and our data sharing policy for the extensive amount of public, private, and confidential data. You'll utilize data cataloging tools such as IBM and Google. This role is part Data Governance team in our Artificial Intelligence & Data (AI&D) Organization, an exciting new center of excellence supporting all of Verizon, reporting into the Global Network & Technology team. Meet with stakeholders from without our Artificial Intelligence and Data Organizatiion as well as across other business groups, to understand data classification needs and create processes around gathering stakeholder requirements. Create and maintain partnering relationships with business leaders at director and manager level with the capability to provide interaction and executive level communications. Create an automated, scalable approach for data classification issue identification and remediation. Create automated reporting for data classification issues. Work with team members and stakeholders, including Verizon India, to take existing frameworks and evolve them to an efficient, effective, world class Data Classification offering. Collaborate with the governance team, data stewards, and business users to create, deploy, and monitor Data Classification rules. Evaluate effectiveness of classification rule sets and present recommended modifications to improve system performance. Extract, manipulate and evaluate accuracy of existing dictionaries and build processes to improve them. Conceptual, creative thinker with ability to discover patterns in seemingly unconnected data points, and turn them into classification methods. You want to make an impact by providing the data that will help improve the experience of our customers. You’ll need to have: Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience. Four or more years of relevant work experience. Experience in data classification. Experience with SQL and Python. Experience with IAM Rule writing. Experience with data cataloging. Experience delivering projects in the data management area: Hadoop, Google Analytics, Data Science, Data Governance. Even better if you have: A degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, Economics, Business Analytics, or a related field. Experience with IBM Cloud Pak. Experience with Data Visualization Tools. Experience with Google Bigquery. Project managements skills, PMP/SAFe certification. Experienced with change management and organizational readiness as part of delivering new capabilities and systems. Knowledge of project tracking tools such as JIRA. Strong communication (written and verbal) and critical thinking. Gravy Analytics is disrupting the world of consumer intelligence. We are the only location-based consumer intelligence platform providing real-world information about the places people visit and the events they attend. Our mission is to be the largest and most accurate source of usable and trusted location intelligence that reveals how consumers live their daily lives. Understanding where people go and how they spend their time gives marketers and analysts unprecedented insight into consumer interests, preferences, and trends.   Gravy Analytics works with leading brands across industries – from finance to retail to professional sports - to provide market research, improve customer engagement, and generate more sales. Our location-powered solutions fuel ad targeting, customer relationship management, and competitive insights, enabling businesses to reach more prospective buyers, to better serve their customers throughout the life cycle, and to stay a step ahead of their competition. Processing billions of location signals daily, Gravy Analytics provides the essential data that powers many of our customers' proprietary solutions, as well as our own products and services.   You should know…Gravy Analytics is a dynamic and fast-growing business! We ranked No. 93 on the 2020 Inc. 5000 Series and No. 226 on the 2021 Inc. 5000 list… and we have no plans of slowing down. We embrace our core values of: Collaboration, Respect, Excellence, Expertise and Vision. If this resonates with you, please apply today! The Opportunity  Gravy Analytics is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join Gravy’s Product Development - Data Team. This is an opportunity to utilize your skills to work in this interesting and challenging field, primarily supporting data analytics and product requests. Successful candidates will be sharp performers, with a demonstrated ability to produce timely insights and analytics. You will know SQL like the back of your hand, and you will have work experience with data visualization tools, statistical analysis or modeling including machine learning models. The ideal candidate will be customer service oriented, innovative, open-minded to the solution set and driven to deliver solutions that meet or exceeds the need. You will research data to help solve business problems, streamline data transformation processes, and analyze complex sets of information to reach conclusions and support building data products. The successful candidate will have a teamwork orientation and be excited to deploy and expand their skills with a growing company in a dynamic industry. What You Will Do   Implement production level solutions and execute on data analytic projects including normalization and statistical modeling  Perform statistical analysis, temporal and pattern analysis, and correlation of events in support of our Geo-Signals Cloud and customer data Produce visual charts and analytics, document and present analytical results, interesting findings, and data anomalies to decision makers and team members  Provide informational briefings to explain methodologies and critical findings as well product technical solutions to cross functional teams and stakeholders  Exhibit strong task management and organizational skills when leading small teams   Skills & Experience   At least four years’ experience in data analysis and a minimum of 6 years’ experience in hands on technical work (in analysis, programming, reporting or visualization)  Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in a technology related field or the completion of multiple courses related to data analysis, data visualization and reporting  You will have great SQL skills and have Linux skills. You are experienced in querying SQL databases and have experience in technologies related to querying data in a data lake such as Zeppelin running on Spark Demonstrated experience with production data, ability to access data and use data extracts, ability to construct and manipulate large data sets of structured and unstructured data sources  Strong foundation built on math and statistical skills and techniques to analyze data, run tests, and create models to gather new insights and predict possible outcomes  Developed statistical code and models in R or Python with a firm understanding of statistical modeling techniques (e.g., linear regression, decision trees, normalization, machine learning), and background in software development is a plus  Experience with QGIS, Tableau and other BI analytics tools at a minimum  Good experience with visualization in Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets to produce pivot tables, utilize formulas and functions, and statistical charts and graphs  Great analytical skills and thought processes with an ability to investigate a problem and find the ideal solution in a timely, efficient manner, and demonstrate excellent troubleshooting skills  Exhibit a data scientist mindset for business challenges with solutions that can be reached with clear cut, methodical approaches or through creative techniques  Implemented creative code base for data improvement and opportunities to continuously improve processes  Strong organizational and time management skills to plan technical data analysis and execute on software/code solutions with experience in breaking down larger tasks & projects into actionable subtasks  Leadership capabilities with prior experience in leading 1 to 2 other team members on larger tasks including producing schedules, reporting status for projects, and deploying products and software into production  You are both a team player and a self-starter. Your communication skills allow you to understand and meet customer and business needs, understand complex data relationships and navigating to produce outputs with little direct supervision  Ability to transform a basic description of what is needed, analyze and ask questions as needed to generate a detailed specification of the data and/or analytics requirements  Effective communication & documentation skills to present findings, trends, and new insights in a fast-paced evolving environment  Pattern recognition skills and the ability to identify relationships between features  Personal characteristics we value include: high integrity, entrepreneurial spirit, innovative thinker, team player, a passion for technology, excellent verbal and written communication skills, flexibility, high energy and attention to detail   We offer competitive salaries and benefits, including equity and unlimited PTO. job_title: Data Analyst II - Data Science Division
job_Description: The Data Science Division (DSD) is part of the Center for Naval Analyses. The mission of the DSD is to develop innovative, cutting-edge analytics that are relevant, impactful, and actionable. The DSD provides data science expertise and support to the Department of the Navy and Department of Defense. The division collaborates with our sponsors to transform their operations by making data and analytics an integral part of their decision-making. As part of the Navy’s only dedicated FFRDC, we use our analytic skills and our knowledge of naval operations to help create a competitive advantage for the Navy. That advantage has never been more critical than it is today, with great power competition challenging the Navy in several concurrent theaters and across all warfighting domains. The division has full time and part time analysts with advanced degrees in data science, operations research, statistics, economics, computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, chemistry, and other technical disciplines. The Data Science Division has a large set of core technical competencies, including:  Developing supervised and unsupervised machine learning models, such as artificial neural networks, random forests, and clustering, to predict outcomes and assist decision-makers  Leveraging high performance computing to obtain insights from big data  Developing custom analytical simulations using techniques such as continuous time, discrete event, and Monte Carlo approaches to approximate existing systems to quantify the effects of changes to improve those systems  Building and deploying dashboards and dynamic decision support tools in the Navy’s cloud environments  Identifying optimal solutions using mathematical programming techniques such as mixed integer programming, network analysis, and linear/non-linear programming.  Leading and facilitating human centered design workshops to ensure data-driven solutions meet stakeholder requirements and preferences  The DSD develops models and analytics to support Navy problems across all Navy domains, including aviation, surface warfare, undersea warfare, cyber, logistics, readiness, force generation, sustainment, acquisition, and cost modeling. DSD analysts support decision-makers by identifying key drivers of both successful and poor performance to improve Navy and Marine Corps outcomes. The division currently supports the Navy’s Performance-to-Plan forum, which provides senior Navy leadership forward looking performance forecasts, which are foundational to articulating Navy progress toward readiness and capability goals. Projects generally involve large datasets and complex questions that demand advanced coding skills as well as statistical and modelling techniques. The division leverages agile project management techniques to support faster cycle times to insights and to develop analytic minimum viable products. CNA fosters an inclusive culture that values diverse backgrounds and perspectives. Our flexible and engaging work environment encourages iterative and creative collaboration at every stage of the problem solving process. Our employees are committed to helping clients develop effective solutions to better manage their programs through scientific, data-driven approaches. PRIMARY PURPOSE Data Analysts II in the Data Science Division work on projects to develop advanced analytics and algorithms for the Department of the Navy and other government agencies to ensure America's defense in the 21st century. Data Analyst II apply CNA's unique approach to analytics that combines an understanding of the technical data science capabilities with experience from military exercises, operations and sponsors. JOB DECRIPTION/DUTIES 1. Leverage R and/or Python to develop machine learning models for, e.g., regression, classification, natural language processing, and/or image recognition. 2. Familiarity with Navy and Marine Corps operations, maintenance, supply, training, and personnel datasets. 3. Extract, transform, load (ETL) data from various data sources in order to initiate analysis. 4. Conduct data preparation including cleaning, wrangling, joining, and converting data in order to provide a useable analytic dataset. 5. Conduct Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) to include the use of data visualizations (e.g. Dash, MATPLOTLIB, R Shiny, ggplot2, Power BI, etc.), correlations, empirical/theoretical distributions of data, and summary statistics. 6. Apply statistical methods including descriptive and inferential techniques using parametric and nonparametric statistics. 7. Communicate analysis and results clearly, concisely and precisely for colleagues and clients. 8. Contribute to the completion of milestones associated with specific projects by analyzing complex datasets and using effective visualizations of data in their results. Establish short-term goals and objectives within sphere of responsibility; help provide a leadership role in developing alternative and new analytic paths. 9. Serve as an effective team member and may lead a portion of a small project by fulfilling assignments in a timely and efficient manner. Works cooperatively by providing clear input to colleagues on tasks. Exhibit a positive attitude, and takes responsibility for own actions and outcomes. 10. Interacts effectively with personnel across the FFRDC. Develops professional and enduring relationships with functional peers within the organization, as well as sponsors / clients/ vendors; sometimes with guidance from others. Interaction normally involves exchange or presentation of factual, but somewhat varied and complex information. 11. Perform other duties as assigned. JOB REQUIREMENTS 1. Education:  Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Operations Research, Computer Science, Math, Statistics, or related field or equivalent combination of education and work experience  2. Experience:  Minimum 2 years relevant experience. Experience with Department of Defense (DOD), the military branches or other government agencies preferred.  3. Skills:  Proficient in applying machine learning techniques, building models (statistical, mathematical, simulation, etc.) in programming languages such as R or Python. Ability to analyze complex datasets using effective visualizations of data in achieved results; skilled in programming, statistics, machine learning, and data visualization. Working knowledge of data and information management analysis techniques and best practices. Experience working in cloud data environments such as AWS and Azure desired. Ability to work with ML tools such as Spark, Databricks, and Data Robot. Ability to construct effective briefings using MS PowerPoint and intermediate to advanced skills with MS Word and Excel and other standard software packages. Ability to communicate information effectively in both oral and written communication. Ability to present and summarize data effectively. Works effectively on a team and able to build rapport with colleagues, clients/sponsors, and staff. Strong customer and client relations skills.  4. Other:  Ability to obtain and maintain an Active Security Clearance. ***Required Documents*** 1. Cover Letter - Please include a cover letter as part of your application to be considered for this position. A cover letter should introduce yourself, briefly summarize your professional background, explain why you are a good candidate and the reason for your personal interest in applying for this job. 2. Transcripts - Please include your transcripts as part of your application to be considered ***Voluntary (but highly desired) document*** Please include a personal statement as part of your application. A personal statement is a chance for us to get to know you. The statement is your opportunity to share your goals, interests, influences and show us that you will be a valuable asset to our organization. Please click here for personal statement guidelines – Click here Personal statements will not be used as an elimination criteria for this position. They will only be used to enhance a candidate’s application. Description  Job Description: The Intelligence Group at Leidos has an opening for a Senior Geospatial Data Scientist to support our customer in Springfield, Virginia. This is an exciting opportunity to use your experience in GIS, scripting, and data science to support a national security customer. As a Geospatial Data Scientist you will develop and apply methods to identify, collect, process, and analyze large volumes of data to build and enhance products, processes, and systems. You will conduct data mining and retrieval, and apply statistical and mathematical analyses to identify trends, solve analytical problems, optimize performance, and gather intelligence. You will also visualize information using a range of tools (e.g., GIS, R, Python, SQL), develop scripts and algorithms, create explanatory and predictive models, and conduct comparative analyses to address complex GEOINT problems. The candidate should have a geospatial background and a strong ability to independently conduct research and initiate projects in support of customer objectives. Primary Responsibilities The candidate will work directly with customers and team members and must be able to create, edit, research, evaluate, analyze, and fuse data from multiple sources and datasets to produce current and finished geospatial intelligence products. The candidate will participate in efforts to develop and apply methods to identify, collect, process, and analyze large volumes of data to build and enhance products, processes, and systems. They will apply the application of programming, statistics and visualization to glean insights from large and disparate data sources. Data Scientists understand and utilize aspects of machine learning to solve and automate classification, regression, cluster analysis, anomaly detection, association discovery, and topic modeling tasks. These scientists understand and utilize solutions with predictive patterns from data into practical, intelligent applications that anyone can use. They visualize information using a range of tools, develop scripts and algorithms, create explanatory and predictive models and conduct comparative analyses to address complex problems. The candidate should have experience in creating and maintaining geodatabases and integrating and managing foundation, intelligence, and multi-INT data into structured geodatabases. The candidate will also create and develop complex scripts and algorithms (e.g. Python), create explanatory and predictive models and conduct comparative analyses to address complex military and intelligence problems. Duties may also include the visualization of information using a range of tools (e.g. Tableau, R, and ESRI Arc-GIS suite, including model builder). Candidate will be expected to provide excellent customer support and consultation, interacting with analytic units in a professional manner to understand their challenges, incorporate their feedback, and provide quality solutions. Basic Qualifications Active TS/SCI Masters of Science or higher in a quantitative discipline  such as data science, mathematics, statistics, earth science, quantitative social sciences, geographic information science, computer science, physics, or a related field. In conjunction with proficiency and at  least five years’  experience with applied data processing and scientific analysis of large datasets and machine learning OR Bachelor of Science degree in a quantitative discipline  such as data science, mathematics, statistics, earth science, quantitative social sciences, geographic information science, computer science, physics, or a related field. In conjunction with proficiency and at  least ten years’  experience with applied data processing and scientific analysis of large datasets and machine learning Knowledge of programming languages (e.g., Python JavaScript, SQL, Pig, or R_), spatial analysis tools and concepts, data mining methods, database structures, and analytic information extraction and visualization Training in applied mathematics including statistics and mathematical modeling to support temporal and pattern analysis, correlation of events, probability analysis, and assessments of sampling, analysis of variance and error, and regression testing and analysis. Competency in one or more programming languages such as JavaScript, Python, or R, for processes, repeatability, efficiency, knowledge capture, hypothesis testing, visualization, and process automation Familiarization with modeling software (e.g. FME, SPSS, SAS) for processes, repeatability, efficiency, knowledge capture, hypothesis testing, visualization, and process automation Experience programmatically connecting to database and web based data sources Knowledge and experience in data mining, cleansing, and exploring spatial, temporal, and non-spatial data in both structured and unstructured formats Experience with one or more cloud based technologies Proficiency in MS Office suite Strong time management skills Comfortable working independently Preferred Qualifications Demonstrated ability to work in a very dynamic and demanding work environment Demonstrated ability to work cooperatively as a team member PhD in a quantitative discipline such as data science, mathematics, statistics, earth science, quantitative social sciences, geographic information science, computer science, physics, or other. Computational analytic modeling: experience engineering and tuning deep learning algorithms for data science. Experience running command line operations in one or more operating systems: Windows and/or Linux (command line) Experience connecting up to two or more database web sources: Database: Postgres, Oracle, SQLite, and/or Arc SDE. Web: API’s GeoJson, REST. Demonstrated experience with two or more cloud based technologies Pay Range:

job_title: Data Scientist - Requires Active TS/SCI with Polygraph Security Clearance
job_Description: Position-Specific Responsibilities: ·  Draft expert quantitative and qualitative analytic assessments. ·  Develop advanced analytic methods to assess the state of intelligence missions. ·  Provide support, reviews, analysis, and feedback on evaluation-related issues.   ·  Develop and maintain data repositories and models for intelligence mission performance data. ·  Assist with the development and maintenance of databases and automated tools; design and develop complex databases, maintain existing data infrastructure, and optimize data infrastructure. ·  Provide expert support to the PAD staff to collect data and conduct analysis on intelligence mission performance to develop products such as Global Coverage Database and Decision Aid Framework. ·  Recommend innovative solutions to data extraction, storage, search, and analysis challenges based on best practices from industry and the IC.  Required Position-Specific Qualifications:    Experience with drafting clear and concise products describing complex data and analysis.    Experience with generating reports, charts, and plots of distributions and trends, descriptive statistics, and complex statistical analyses.    Experience performing quantitative and qualitative analysis and methodology development.    Ability to work effectively in analytic teams.    Experience developing custom scripts, queries, and visualizations to support analysis of IC data.    Understanding of descriptive statistics, regression.    Experience conducting data extraction, parsing, manipulation, and storage; quantitative and qualitative analysis based on a large volume of data from various IC databases.    Experience designing IC solutions based on user requirements.    Knowledge of IC cloud services.  Desired Knowledge, Skills, and Experience:    Experience with drafting evaluation reports using enterprise data integration and metrics.    Substantial experience with applying quantitative and qualitative analytic methods, including the design, development, and management of statistical models and enterprise-wide evaluations.    Knowledge of intelligence priority topics and the supporting intelligence information needs.    Experience with natural language processing tools and techniques.

The Data Science Team  applies expertise in machine learning, computational architectures, data visualization, and simulation to solve hard research challenges in high impact areas including cybersecurity, biological systems, and distributed sensor platforms. We've built large-scale data mining and generation pipelines, prototypes to visualize graphs with millions of nodes, and automated systems that detect malware, summarize source code, and predict protein stability.  Our team values creativity, initiative, collaboration, and diversity. We strive for a fun and collegial atmosphere that encourages intellectual cross-pollination and professional growth. We're passionate about learning, empowering our customer's missions, and working together at the leading edge of technology!  As a  Machine Learning Researcher , you will research state-of-the-art machine learning techniques and build realistic adversarial evasion and poisoning attacks for network-domain AI systems. In particular, your research will explore adversarial techniques applied in the network traffic domain. You will implement attacks in TensorFlow or PyTorch using. You will work on a multidisciplinary project team that includes experts in machine learning and network security, with clients that include DARPA and other Government Agencies.  Basic Qualifications:   2+ years of experience applying machine learning to challenging research problems.  Deep knowledge of adversarial examples and trojan attacks/poisoning against machine learning models or experience with adversarial machine learning toolkits (ART, CleverHans, etc.)  1+ year of demonstrable programming experience with Python and PyTorch or TensorFlow.  Comfortable analyzing complex problems and communicating research results.  Relevant BS degree (CS, EE, math/stats, etc.) or equivalent practical experience.  Eligible and willing to obtain a US security clearance.   Preferred Qualifications:   Familiar with networking concepts and protocols.  Familiar with software development tools and platforms (Git, Docker, Jupyter, etc.).  Expertise in numerical optimization techniques.  Advanced degree or publication record in an applicable technical field.  Active DoD security clearance.   Two Six Technologies is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at Two Six Technologies without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, physical and mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, veteran, marital, pregnancy or citizenship status; or any other status prohibited by applicable national, federal, state or local law. Information provided will be kept confidential and used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.

Who Are We? We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms, ground, soldier, and maritime systems in 50+ locations world-wide. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in the fields of sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR). QinetiQ Inc.’s dedicated experts in defense, aerospace, security, and related fields all work together to explore new ways of protecting the American Warfighter, Security Forces, and Allies. Being a part of QinetiQ Inc. means being central to the safety and security of the world around us. Partnering with our customers, we help save lives; reduce risks to society; and maintain the global infrastructure on which we all depend. Why Join QinetiQ Inc.? If you have the courage to take on a wide variety of complex challenges, then you will experience a unique working environment where innovative teams blend different perspectives, disciplines, and technologies to discover new ways of solving complex problems. In our diverse and inclusive environment, you can be authentic, feel valued, be respected, and realize your full potential. QinetiQ Inc. will support you with workplace flexibility, a commitment to the health and well-being of you and your family and provide opportunities to work with a purpose. We are committed to supporting your success in both your professional and personal lives.  Your Contribution to Our Mission: QinetiQ Inc is seeking an experienced Lead Data Scientist with extensive knowledge in the field of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning to lead a team of scientists and engineers in developing a set of next generation AI solutions to support the Warfighter effort. Providing expertise and hands on experience related to algorithm development applicable to image and signal processing, Aided Target Recognition (AiTR), Artificial Intelligence (AI), and Machine Learning (ML). About Us: Bennett Aerospace, Inc.   is headquartered in Raleigh, North Carolina. Established in 2008, we are a woman owned, veteran owned, certified 8(a) small business that provides scientific, engineering, and technical advisory services to our customers. Primarily focused on Federal Government clients in general, and the Department of Defense in particular, Bennett Aerospace provides expert guidance and advice on the full spectrum of R&D and its applications in engineering, science, medicine, and IT, as well as providing strategic programmatic support in order to meet customer goals and objectives. Bennett Aerospace is a rapidly growing business focused on hiring and retaining the best people. Job Description: Bennett Aerospace ,  Inc.  has an opening for a highly motivated  Data Scientist  (Business Analyst, Senior)  in support of a Federal Law Enforcement client located in  Arlington, VA.  The  Data Scientist  will use his or her knowledge of applying analytic methodologies and principles to address program needs while maintaining program confidentiality. He or she will provide analytic support in the areas of data collection and analysis, reliability and validation in order to determine and project economic and financial impact; cost analysis and strategic planning. He or she will utilize a set of tasks and techniques to work with stakeholders/team in order to assist with the analysis, evaluation, and preparation for recommendations for improvements, optimization, development and/or maintenance efforts in specialized areas. Regular, predictable attendance is essential for satisfactory performance as is the ability to work both with minimal direction and within a team environment. In addition, the successful candidate will report directly and responsively to the Bennett Aerospace Program Manager on all immediate project work. Responsibilities: Key Responsibilities and Duties: Identify and provide recommendations in developing analyses and evaluations consistent with regulatory policy, internal policies, and state of the art tools and techniques. Research, interpret and analyze applicable laws, regulations, policies and memoranda to identify current thinking and analytical constructs that can be effective. Conduct in-depth research on a wide range of topics, including analyses, drug threats, evaluations, staffing models, and strategic planning. Analyze and strategically work complex issues or problems affecting the DEA Diversion program. Perform financial analysis and related support functions relevant to department budget and strategic planning function. Develop reports and make recommendations to improve business processes, procedures, and performance. Assist in performing analyses and interpretation of cost and expense variances. Compiles and analyzes financial information. Performs financial forecasting and reconciliation. Develop reports and make recommendations to improve business processes, procedures and performance. Create and analyze monthly, quarterly and annual reports and ensure information has been recorded accurately. Identify trends and developments in competitive environments and presents findings. Coordinate performance metrics gathering, analysis, and reporting activities. Participate in the processes and methods changes and reviews existing policy or suggested changes for impact in implementation and application. Participate in establishing and coordinating program plan requirements and interface with each section/office. Evaluate, monitor, and report performance against plans to ensure guidelines meet appropriate procedures and policies. Work independently to review and prepare documents addressing unconventional issues and/or problems affecting the program; work to identify trends and areas for improvements in procedures. Participate in project performance team meetings on behalf of the job unit in order to provide ideas, methods or processes for unit/department performance improvement. Develop and maintain spreadsheets, tracking databases, reports, and presentations; generate and document information for statistical purposes; utilize government database systems and word processing software; compile files on initiatives for DC personnel as requested. Creates briefings for senior management outlining changes or modifications on relevant laws, regulations and policies. Participate in discussions, meetings, conferences, and conference calls with agency administrative, subject matter experts, and technical personnel, and other federal agency officials. Perform other related duties as assigned.  Qualifications: Education and Experience: Bachelors Degree required, Masters Degree preferred Minimum of five (5) years of relevant experience required. Strong technical writing, analytical, proofreading, and research skills. UFMS database experience highly desired Expert level MS Excel skills (pivots, formula) Intermediate to advanced skills in manipulating data in Excel preferred. Experience performing extensive research utilizing multiple data sources systems preferred. Skills and Abilities: Able to work as part of a team or independently with minimal direction. Ability to conduct cost/benefit analysis. Ability to be flexible and adaptable in a variety of situations Ability to multi-task; detail oriented; be observant and anticipate operational needs Excellent problem solver and able to handle difficult situations Strong computer skills; proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, and Outlook), technology systems, and communications tools (Adobe). Strong oral and interpersonal skills Professional demeanor Strong organizational skills. Must be a US Citizen with the ability to obtain a US Government security clearance. Successful Pass of Bennett Aerospace Background Investigation, Drug Screening and Credit Check. Job Description: Position:  Senior Data Scientist Location:  Reston or Remote Per Executive Order 14042, new or prospective Comscore, Inc. employees in the United States, must provide proof of complete vaccination, or approved exemption on the first day of their employment. About This Role: Comscore is a leading big data technology company that measures what matters to make cross-platform audiences and advertising more valuable. We are seeking a Data Scientist to mine our large-scale data sets (2 Trillion + records/month) and provide insights to help inform our clients strategy for launching and analyzing marketing campaigns around the world. The data scientist will be responsible for data analysis, design, and development of Cross Platform audience measurement products. Their work will have a direct impact on driving business strategies for prominent industry leaders. Self-motivation and strong communication skills are both must haves. You will need to be comfortable working in a fast-paced work environment with shifting priorities, vague requirements, and rapid iterations. You will need to be comfortable taking risks. What, where, and when do people watch video content? Which sites and platforms are changing the behavior of consumer video consumption? How and where is traditional TV viewing shifting towards internet connected devices? What is the total audience for publishers with fragmented content across TV, computer, and mobile? How do we build flexible processes to handle the various data sources and reporting needs? About our team: Were a small but powerful team of data junkies, analyzing over 20 TB of data each day to deliver product and research solutions to our clients. We use Scala, Spark, SQL, Hadoop, Python, and many other tools. We work with Product Management on what problems to tackle and collaborate with Data Science and Software Engineering teams to create solutions. What You'll Do: Design and prototype solutions for data processing and methodology Drive architecture for analytical projects that span across multiple teams and functions Build, test new features and concepts and integrate into production process Participate in ongoing research and evaluation of new technologies Exercise your experience in the development lifecycle through analysis, design, development, testing and deployment of this system Collaborate with teams in Software Engineering, Operations, and Product Management to deliver timely and quality data. The Transportation Security Administration (TSA) is a high-performing counterterrorism organization, providing the most effective security in the most efficient way. In support of TSA’s mission, the Information Technology (IT) office provides world-class information technology services. The Enterprise Architecture Division (EAD) within the IT office delivers mission-driven architecture through collaboration, innovation, and leadership. Since the formation of EAD, TSA has successfully established many elements of a comprehensive Enterprise Architecture (EA) programs and continues to enhance and mature the program to make its EA actionable and to provide value-added services to its customers. EA plays a critical role in enabling the TSA mission by aligning technology with information and capabilities, enabling strategic and tactical decision making, and simplifying information and technology management processes. Utilizing a set of strategic principles to frame decisions helps TSA fulfill its vital mission in a more efficient and effective manner. The EA Support Services (EASS) contract is an IT support services contract that maintains and improves the TSA enterprise architecture and governance processes as TSA strives to meet its mission and move towards achieving its long-term strategic vision. Key Responsibilities Create, maintain, and guide conceptual and logical models at the enterprise, segment, and solution level, spanning multiple special domains (e.g., aviation security, biometrics, geospatial, cloud, mobile). Create enterprise information/data views. Gather and analyze information and data to generate new or enhance existing enterprise views to convey as-is and to-be architecture. Provide strategic information and data/architectural service. Research and analyze specific capabilities or technology areas including but not limited to semantic technologies, robotic process automation, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. Provide enterprise information and data management support, to include: Establish and enforce TSA information and data architectural principles and standards. Provide enterprise information/data management support. Provide services to enhance TSA EA information and data management maturity. Identification of EA-related data and information. Implement recommendations and best practices from the TSA Enterprise Information and Data Study. Explore the application of technology to different problem sets. Conduct pilots to demonstrate the power of ML/AI and other automation tools. Create implementation roadmaps for successful automation pilots. Provide support to stand up the TSA Chief Data Officer (CDO) function. Required Qualifications Ability to obtain a Clearance/Security: DHS EOD which requires US Citizenship. Education: Bachelor’s degree preferred but not required. At least 5+ years of experience in Information and Data Architecture preferred but not required. Knowledge and experience with information & Data Architecture development using data modeling tools and EA Frameworks is required. Must have expertise in data analytics and data visualization. Experience in providing technical and subject matter expertise for continued maintenance and enhancement. Demonstrated capability in providing information and data architectural support services across solution architecture. segment architecture, and enterprise architecture. Strong written and verbal skills. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Candidates that do not meet the required qualifications will not be considered. Cognosante will not provide sponsorship for employment-based immigration benefits for this position. As a covered federal contractor, Cognosante requires all employees regardless of position, work location or telework status to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by December 8, 2021 or prior to your start date; whichever comes first. Cognosante will consider requests for reasonable accommodations due to disability or sincerely held religious belief. Cognosante is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

PhD degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research and related fields or MS degree + 4 years of experience  1+ years hands-on experience developing software in Python, Java, C#, C++ or other object-oriented programming languages  2+ years of hands-on experience building machine learning models for business applications  Sound theoretical understanding of broad machine learning concepts, with deep and demonstrable expertise in at least one topic or application of machine learning  Job summary The AWS Infrastructure Planning group is responsible for planning and coordinating a complex, multi-tier supply chain that delivers capacity for all AWS services. We are responsible for ensuring that the AWS cloud remains elastic for its customers by taking care of all of the back-end complexity, enabling our infrastructure to stay ahead of our rapid growth. As part of the Applied Research team, you’ll partner closely with other software development engineers and product managers with a clear path to business impact. Working alongside fellow applied scientists, you’ll leverage your expertise to develop new machine learning techniques and develop statistical models for demand forecasting at different levels of aggregation, lead time and supply predictions, order promising, supply chain risk detection and simulation of complex systems. Successful candidates will have a deep knowledge of statistical and machine learning methods, the ability to map models into scalable production systems, the communication skills necessary to explain complex technical approaches to a variety of stakeholders and customers, and the ability to take an iterative approach to tackle ambiguous long-term problems. Key job responsibilities  Understand business requirements and existing challenges and map them to the right scientific solution.  Research, prototype, experiment, implement and launch machine learning models to solve problems that matter to our customers.  Lead project plans from a scientific perspective by managing product features, technical risks, milestones and launch plans  Create, enhance, and maintain technical documentation, and present to other Scientists, Product, and Engineering teams.  Influence the organization's long-term roadmap and resourcing, onboard new technologies onto our team's toolbox  Develop the right set of metrics to evaluate efficiency/accuracy of the algorithms.  Mentor and develop the scientist community across the organization.  About the team The AWS Infrastructure Supply Chain Technology Applied Research team drives technological advances and develops machine learning, optimization and simulation products to address complex challenges in the AWS Infrastructure supply chain. We sit at the intersection of science and engineering, and innovate on behalf of customers to solve ambiguous problems that haven’t quite been fully articulated or even anticipated.   PhD degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or related fields  4+ years of hands-on experience in building machine learning systems and integrating AI/ML into large-scale production applications  Familiarity deploying solutions to AWS or cloud services and experience with AWS services such as AWS Lambda, SageMaker, Amazon S3 and Amazon Elastic Container Service is considered a plus  Publications at peer-reviewed conferences or journals  Demonstrated industry leadership in your area of specialization  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Company Description Publicis Sapient is a digital transformation partner helping established organizations get to their future, digitally-enabled state, both in the way they work and the way they serve their customers. We help unlock value through a start-up mindset and modern methods, fusing strategy, consulting and customer experience with agile engineering and problem-solving creativity. United by our core values and our purpose of helping people thrive in the brave pursuit of next, our 20,000+ people in 53 offices around the world combine experience across technology, data sciences, consulting and customer obsession to accelerate our clients’ businesses through designing the products and services their customers truly value.   Job Description The selected individual will serve in a digital communications strategy and analytics capacity within a Federal government agency focused on health, science, and research. The work will support the overall marketing communications strategy of the organization, playing a key role in the measurement, evaluation, and optimization of digital channels and campaigns. The right person for the role will feel comfortable in a highly collaborative, client-facing environment, but will also be able to work independently and take ownership of their assignments while establishing themselves as a trusted resource and expert that enables client success. Core functionality of the role includes executing measurement and analytics practices for organization-wide marketing activities, including definition of measurement approach, data aggregation and analysis, and development of reporting deliverables; communicating outcomes and strategic recommendations to both client and internal stakeholders through thoughtful information design and data visualization; and collaborating across teams to champion a data-driven environment focused on the continual improvement of digital communications initiatives. The role will also support search engine optimization (SEO) practices through implementation of best practices and industry standards. In addition to digital marketing and analytics expertise, candidates should be comfortable working in a general consulting capacity, with experience or interest in strategic consulting, project facilitation, content development, and reporting. Responsibilities: Foster client success through support of digital analytics, marketing communications, and search engine optimization (SEO) initiatives Aggregate and analyze data from a variety of sources and derive actionable insights to optimize future communications strategy and performance Develop and provide omni-channel reporting deliverables (e.g., strategic dashboards, performance reports) to client stakeholders on both a regularly scheduled and ad hoc basis Communicate outcomes and recommendations and provide guidance on best practices, strategic planning, and creative direction to achieve project goals Integrate with client teams to understand project goals and objectives, identify key performance indicators (KPIs), and establish targets informed by historical performance or industry benchmarks Interpret strategic planning to define and implement appropriate performance measurement approach, including custom dimensions and events in Google Analytics or new technologies Coordinate with development teams to ensure accurate accounting and execution of functional reporting requirements   Qualifications  Must be a U.S. Citizen or U.S. Legal Permanent Resident Eligible for U.S. Government Clearance. Bachelor’s Degree required from college or University Five to eight years of relevant work experience in digital marketing strategy and analytics; search engine optimization (SEO) experience is a plus Significant experience in using digital analytics tools, such as Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics, to support the broader measurement approach; implementation experience is a plus Understanding of technologies required to facilitate reporting and digital analytics practices, including HTML, JavaScript, etc. Demonstrated understanding of multi-channel marketing campaigns, including both traditional and digital formats Capable of applying critical thinking, logic, and creativity to solve complex reporting and analytics tasks Proven ability to merge and transform data into actionable insights through analysis; identify key themes between channels and visualize data points in a meaningful format Ability to create and deliver clear, powerful and concise presentations or proposals; highly proficient in Word, Excel, PowerPoint Capable of explaining detailed analytical concepts or results to less technical stakeholders via a variety of formats Additional Information As part of our dedication to an inclusive and diverse workforce, Publicis Sapient is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at hiring@publicissapient.com or you may call us at  +1-617-621-0200 .
